characters: HORUS AND BEK ON A BALCONY
DOCKS ON THE SHORE OF THE NILE
HORUS AND SET ON THE RIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What looks like a handsome MAN walks along the shore of t NILE RIVER, its surface sparkling in the sun. He is

dialogues.speaker: OSIRIS
dialogues.text: The God of Nature and Life. 40s. (The ages of gods are ho old they appear -- many are ancient.) He wears a simple crown. His immense power belied by a gentle, open demeano THOTH’S VOICE The god Osiris had dominion over the lands made bountiful by the Nile. The power of its waters flowed through him. And so he could make life. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOTUS FLOWERS magically BLOOM as Osiris passes, sprouting from his footprints on the silty shore in a ribbon of lif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESERT the color of blood lurks beyond the lush green lan Here stands another PYRAMID, made entirely of SAND... its surface in constant motion... held together by magic. THOTH’S VOICE Osiris’ brother Set ruled the far Desert, where nothing can grow. He drew vast power from the fire that burned at the center of the world.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Stands over a FIERY PIT IN THE EARTH, drawing sustenance its molten depths. 40s. The God of the Desert. Physically powerful, yet cunning. THOTH’S VOICE But despite his power, Set was eternally jealous of his brother... because Osiris could give life -- and he could not. Set is joined by a fearsome cabal of GODS and MEN... THOTH’S VOICE His jealousy corrupted him. Blessed with great cleverness, Set sowed confusion in others. Blessed with great strength, he exploited their weaknesses. (beat) And so the wicked were drawn to Set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILLAGERS watch Osiris expectantly... as he plants SEEDS waters them... Vibrant GRAIN SEEDLINGS magically SPROUT.. THOTH’S VOICE Osiris shared his gifts with Men, teaching them to plant and harvest. To make laws and live in peace. In return, Men loved their king. Thankful Villagers bow before Osiris. A sudden WIND blows (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: 30s, bronzed skin, his form and features are perfection. ENTERS boldly with a slain lion draped over his shoulder, spoils of his hunt... clutching a jug of wine in his othe hand. He leads a ROWDY band of GODS in celebration... THOTH’S VOICE Osiris had a son, Horus, who was Lord of the Air. (beat) Osiris wished his son would rule at his side... Horus, full of wine, inadvertently tramples the seedlings father planted. THOTH’S VOICE ..-but like the wind, Horus was restless and volatile. ON OSIRIS. Disappointment. He kneels to restore the seedlings his son crushed without even noticing... EXT. OSIRIS’ GARDEN - NIGHT Osiris WALKS in his garden, enjoying the night with his w the Queen:

dialogues.speaker: ISIS
dialogues.text: 40s. She radiates power, commanding respect, a goddess ab all other goddesses. Uncompromising in all things -- especially her unyielding love for her husband. THOTH’S VOICE After eons of enmity, Set visited his brother. A strange and disturbing BEAST DARTS from tree to tree be Osiris... It’s like a jackal -- but bigger. A curved snou filled with fangs, square ears, forked tail, and canine b BEHIND Osiris, the beast TRANSFORMS INTO SET. His KNIFE flashes in the darkness... THOTH’S VOICE If Set could not give life, he would take it. Set STABS Osiris in the back. Isis wails as Osiris DIES in her arms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set places the crown on his head as his CONSPIRATORS surr Osiris’ body... THOTH’S VOICE That night, Set cut Osiris’ body into fourteen pieces. The heart was never found. BLOOD RED BANNERS are raised high... They depict a styliz profile of the beast with a long snout and tall ears. The symbol of Set. The GODS OF OSIRIS’ COURT huddle, cowed in terror. THOTH’S VOICE Gods bowed to Set or fled. Men worshipped him or were enslaved. Over the sound of Isis’ lamentation, WE PUSH IN ON the ba of Set... Until RED FILLS THE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus kneels at his father’s sarcophagus, grieving... The sound of his mother’s sorrow still lingers, ever-present. THOTH’S VOICE Horus did not know how much he loved his father until it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of Isis’ crying becomes the WHISTLING WIND... THOTH’S VOICE Years passed. HORUS’ HAND grips a banner of Set... THOTH’S VOICE Those that loved Osiris prayed for his son to return. His hand releases the banner... The wind sucks it away... Toward a distant MOUNTAIN PEAK... The cloth getting small and smaller until it’s just a red speck... THOTH’S VOICE They thought Horus would save them. They thought he would be a wise and just king, like his father. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACKLIT against the sun, Horus pulls a SPEAR from a line spears stuck upright in the ground. His EYES flare, unnaturally bright. Like twin stars, burning as they aim. THOTH’S VOICE But Horus’ Eyes -- eyes that can see everything -- have been focused on only one thing. Horus’ muscled arm cocks back and HURLS the spear... The force parts the air in a SONIC BOOM -- THOTH’S VOICE Vengeance. WE FOLLOW THE SPEAR... Like a missile, it SAILS FOR MILES A blur over forested landscape -- PINNING the BANNER OF S to_a FAR CLIFF. Bulls-eye. ON HORUS. We finally see his face. There is no satisfacti from the feat, only relentless concentration. Horus reaches for another spear -- surprisingly GRABS ONL AIR...

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: It would be good day to kill him, wouldn't it? Very poetic...

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Twirls the spear -- swiped from under Horus’ nose. The Go of Stealth and Horus’ fiercely loyal friend and mentor. L 30s, gray-haired. Squat as a barrel yet quick as a shadow

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: I hear Set’s celebrating the anniversary of your father’s death with a big festival... Music, dancing. A grand time. ON HORUS. It’s no secret. Horus snatches back his spear..

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: If I’m not, you’ve been wasting the last ten years. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: (off the spear) I taught you to throw it straight enough. (prodding) And every time you do, I suppose you picture Set cutting up your father’s body while he forced your mother to watch. Horus’ anger flares. Why is Wepwawet provoking Horus?

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: But of course you didn't actually see it, did you? You weren't there at all. You were off wandering the earth, being a child. When your father needed a man. The foliage near Horus BURSTS INTO FLAME. We see when Hor gets angry, his body literally RADIATES HEAT.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You know I loved him. I should run you through...

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: (points at the far cliff) Too easy. Hit the target instead. Horus THROWS his spear again... As he does so, his head CHANGES, for a split second, into that of a FALCON -- His spear MISSES the banner he hit before. Instead, it shears off the side of the far cliff, causing an AVALANCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of silence between them. It’s clear what the lesso is. Even if the student doesn't want to accept it.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: If you fight Set in anger, you'll lose.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The anger will never leave. And I can’t wait that long. Wepwawet slaps Horus on the back, trying to lighten the m

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Let this day come and go. Finally Horus nods, agreeing... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus THROWS his last spear with all his might... As if t could purge years of pent-up grief.

dialogues.speaker: UP IN THE STRATOSPHERE
dialogues.text: The SONIC BOOM creates a powerful WINDSTORM... THOTH’S VOICE But this is not just a story of Horus’ quest for revenge -- the fate of all Egypt hung in the balance... FOLLOW THE WIND across Egypt... over FIELDS and FORESTS.. THOTH’S VOICE Even the fate of overlooked, unappreciated Man. (beat ) One in particular. Not even I could have imagined he'd help save the immortal land of the gods...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A YOUNG MAN, passionately kissing a YOUNG WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Early 20s. Wiry build. Sharp good looks. A devil-may-care glint in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Also early 20s. She’s beautiful by any measure, with emer green eyes. Steadfast in her beliefs. We’re too close to see exactly where they are -- but they recline on luxurious pillows... Bek playfully shows Zaya a bottle of PERFUMED OIL...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (off the oil) Real Mendesian. She's impressed. Bek opens the back of her dress, exposin the skin. He kneads the oil into tired muscles...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Yes... Higher... That’s it... (eyes closed, off the oil) Who did you steal it from? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: An outrageous suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: How about the money to buy it?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Less outrageous. This is not a thing Zaya approves of, but she’s not judgi

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: In a different world you’d find an honest trade, right?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: In a different world, absolutely. ON BEK. But in this world, not a chance in hell. Bek pulls her on top of him... She squeals, delighted, th covers her mouth. Was she too loud? We REVEAL Bek and Zaya are in a RICHLY APPOINTED OFFICE. pillows arranged in a makeshift bed on the floor... We realize there’s something illicit going on here.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You know we can’t go on like this. It’s too dangerous for you.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (kisses him) It’s worth it. A GUST OF WIND batters the blinds. They both jump, startl

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Wind came out of nowhere...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Nothing in Egypt comes from nowhere. (beat) It's Horus. He’s coming to end all this. We SEE the view out the window: A MULTITUDE of men and women toiling... SLAVES. A vast, pitiful tableau of tears, sweat and blood. All to build (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SET’S GREAT OBELISK It blots out the sun. Millions of tons of rock cut and polished and assembled into a tower still UNDER CONSTRUCT We see the hand of the gods in the uncanny height of the Obelisk... and GIANT SCARAB BEETLES, bigger than elephant laboring as great beasts of burden. All six legs strain against their yokes to raise massive chunks of stone. HIGH WALLS encircle the site. This place is a prison. A familiar sight to Bek and Zaya, but they still hate it.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Sometimes wind is just wind.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (gravely) Not today of all days -- the day Set celebrates his murder of Osiris.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Horus... Set... I couldn’t give a shit about either of them. Zaya’s learned to endure Bek’s blasphemous provocations..

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: I pity the man who believes in nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (steals a kiss) Never said I believed in nothing. A BELL RINGS out in the construction zone...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Urshu will be coming back to take his meal.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Of what, children? As Zaya straightens her dress, Bek notices a SMALL FIGURI hanging from a cord around her neck. A bright-blue cerami representation of a man with a falcon’s head: Horus.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (off the figurine) I told you to get rid of that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (indignant, hiding it under her collar) You told me? I’m not your servant.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Me being here is dangerous enough. If you’re caught, you’ll be out there in the slave pits. (beat) And on top of everything you carry around an amulet of Horus? An even more ferocious blast of wind KNOCKS open the blin Architectural plans BLOW off the desk and AROUND THE ROOM The SOUND of APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS out in the hall...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (agitated, to Bek) Go. I'll finish. Bek bounds OUT THE WINDOW with startling dexterity. He HA from the window ledge by his fingertips and peers in...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: Stalks in with an ENTOURAGE of Overseers. He’s 30s, a for military hero, tasked by Set to oversee construction of t Obelisk. The most feared and envied man in Egypt. Zaya’s cleaning up... This is Urshu’s house... and Zaya i Urshu's servant. Urshu notes his jumbled desk...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: (curt, to Zaya) You don’t control the wind. But I'd think you could close a window.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: And why is my meal unprepared? As Zaya leaves, Urshu GRIPS her wrist. She grimaces in pa

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: If I ever find this room disordered again I'll throw you outside to push stone. Zaya nods, terrified of Urshu and EXITS... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: BEK OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Jumps over to the NEXT WINDOW, opening into a HALLWAY. He speaks furtively with Zaya as she leaves Urshu’s office..

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: This is the last day you’1l be forced to serve him. (beat ) I'm buying you from that bastard.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: At the festival, there’ll be tons of tribute for the king. The idea is beyond comprehension to her.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: You plan to rob a god? In his palace? Set can kill you with a touch.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: He also has a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: You've never tried anything like that before.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You don’t know what I’ve tried.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (grips her Horus figurine) Have faith. Bek dismissively waves away the wishful thinking.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Even if Horus comes and puts a spear through Set’s skull -- then what? In Egypt you’re either rich, poor... (off the slaves outside) +..or nothing. Zaya doesn’t have a response. It’s the hard truth.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I choose rich. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bek gives Zaya a last kiss and LEAPS OFF THE WINDOW LEDGE BACK IN URSHU’S OFFICE As the Overseers summarize the day’s progress... Urshu catches sight of an oddly bright dot on the floor... He bends to touch it -- a drop of OIL, reflecting the sun. ON URSHU. Sniffing it. Suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: Mendesian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek EXITS Urshu’s luxurious FOREMAN’S PAVILION... Snatche an untended JUG OF WATER to blend in with the other FREE running errands to and from the FRONT GATE...

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS OF SET
dialogues.text: Monitor the site. Uniforms emblazoned with Set’s RED SYMB Bek sees a LINE OF NEW SLAVES file through the GATE in chains, fresh labor for the Obelisk...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Always someone’s got more than you, but always someone’s got less... Bek hears CRIES OF PAIN and the SIZZLE of burnt flesh. HIGH PRIESTS OF SET stand before burning braziers. They MUTTER incantations. The flames turn an unnatural BLOOD R The Priests heat BRANDING IRONS in the magical flames and BRAND the newcomers’ shoulders, marking them as slaves. NEARBY, a DESPERATE SLAVE in the work zone is delirious w dehydration... Bek inadvertently catches his eye...

dialogues.speaker: DESPERATE SLAVE
dialogues.text: (off Bek’s jug of water) Please. ON BEK. He doesn’t want to get involved... but he can’t j leave the guy like this. Bek surreptitiously ROLLS THE JU to the Desperate Slave... A CRUEL OVERSEER’S BOOT comes down on the jug. He scans t crowd to see who sent the water... Bek keeps his head dow (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Desperate Slave’s last bit of hope empties into the d He makes a MAD DASH for the GATE -- and accidentally COLL with Bek...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (voice low to the Slave) Don’t. You bear Set’s brand. You're cursed now. The Slave won’t listen. He runs wildly, PASSING the Gate

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You can’t leave -- The burnt flesh of the Slaves’s brand SPREADS ACROSS HIS like a cancer. The dark magic turns the slave to DUST. This is “Set’s Curse.” For the branded, there is no way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BEK. Repulsed. But that’s the way of things. He has other, more pressing concerns...

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (waving Bek through) Enjoy the festival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capital of Egypt sits on the banks of the mighty NILE Merchant ships crowd the river like an ancient superhighw It's as if Manhattan were carved from marble then gilt in gold. Engineering beyond anything we associate with the ancient world. Brand new pyramids shine, smooth as glass. And towering over everything, like a buttress supporting sky, is Set’s Obelisk.

dialogues.speaker: PUSH IN ON
dialogues.text: A long procession of WEALTHY NOBLES steadily move up a GR AVENUE lined on both sides by towering golden statues... Toward the palace GATE. There’s anticipation in the air for the FESTIVAL celebrat Set’s defeat of Osiris, those names on everyone's lips. The POOR are pressed along the avenue... They stare longingly at the privileged wealthy as they pass... ON BEK. Amongst the throng of poor. His expression isn't exactly longing, but that of a hunter locked on his quarr (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A caravan of tribute loaded with every TREASURE imaginabl CHESTS of GOLD, IVORY, LAPIS and PRECIOUS STONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple FISHERMAN elbows Bek, making conversation.

dialogues.speaker: FISHERMAN
dialogues.text: Imagine having all that...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand, open-air “Hypostyle” COURTYARD that seats hundre It’s surrounded by row after row of colossal PILLARS like forest of stone. AT THE GATE, Bek enters with the crowd... A broad-shouldered HOODED MAN walks with purpose, accidentally shoulder-checking Bek.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Watch it. The Hooded Man MOVES ON without noticing. Bek sniffs. Rud REVEAL the Hooded Man is Horus... Bek DARTS stealthily behind a pillar, avoiding the watchf eyes of SOLDIERS... Bek’s fingertips find seams in the limestone as he CLIMBS... No one the wiser. Osiris’ glittering Palace has changed since we last saw i Now the seat of Set’s power. His ARMED SOLDIERS are everywhere. RED BANNERS drape from the marble heights. Th look like never-ending streams of blood.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Sits on a THRONE on a raised dais. Implacable. NOBLES file by Set’s feet. Bow deeply. In fear. In awe. Blessed to be in his presence. Set does not look at them, nor the TREASURES they bear. He is consumed by his own thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Laughs. A sound beautiful as summer raindrops. The beautiful Goddess of Love, Music, and Alcohol, 20s, styli in a turquoise sheath dress. She sits close to Set, her h on his knee. The most desirable woman anyone has ever see (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (flicking her hair) How can you ignore such treasure? Hathor is speaking of herself, of course, and Set knows i

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Today has a single purpose. She's a perfect beauty. Perfect company. But we sense it’ a mask. We can’t see what’s going on behind her eyes. Festival-goers crowd in... MUSICIANS play pipes and drums DANCERS SHAKE ceremonial rattles -- and everything else,

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (to Set) You really think he’s going to come? After all this time?

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (dry) ; I’m honoring his father. How can he not?

dialogues.speaker: BEK HIGH OVERHEAD
dialogues.text: HOPS from PILLAR TO PILLAR in a chain of death-defying leaps... Moving toward the PILE OF TRIBUTE...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE GRAND COURTYARD
dialogues.text: The music STOPS. Time for the entertainment to begin. An ORATOR sets the stage for today’s performance...

dialogues.speaker: ORATOR
dialogues.text: (speaking to the crowd) Today we mark the ascension of our King to Egypt’s throne... as we celebrate the downfall of craven Osiris at his hand. A brutish actor/warrior playing “OSIRIS” stalks out into courtyard. The Audience BOOS... Another actor/warrior plays “Set.” He wears a RED HELMET that looks like a strange LONG-SNOUTED BEAST with sharp e

dialogues.speaker: ORATOR
dialogues.text: Witness, fine lords and glorious gods, a reenactment of the supreme Lord Set’s brave vanquishing of the wretched pretender to the crown. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Nobles in the stands wait expectantly for the action. No less excited are a congress of

dialogues.speaker: LESSER GODS
dialogues.text: Chattering in low tones, lest they offend Set. They look like idealized humans, above lowly mankind. Notable among them a GOD OF VIRILITY with the personality of a Donkey. humorless HARVEST GODDESS. And

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: A bullish God of Butchers. Head of Set’s Palace security. There's also a HALF-DOZEN BABOONS off to the side of Set’ throne. They hunch over papyrus scrolls, busily writing d what they see. One Baboon accidentally spills his ink... staining Mnevis sandal. Mnevis draws a sword to slay the offending creatu

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Mnevis -- it is my guest.

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: The God of Wisdom was your guest. He sent baboons.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Thoth prefers his own company.

dialogues.speaker: ORATOR
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Behold the liberation of our splendid Egypt! “Osiris” ATTACKS “Set.” “Set” fights back in self-defense A mockery of the true events. The Audience is riveted.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: This isn’t the story I remember.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: One of the spoils of victory is chronicling your opponent's defeat. And the cruder the performance, the more likely Horus will be baited.

dialogues.speaker: HOODED HORUS
dialogues.text: Watches the “entertainment” from the shadows BEHIND THE STANDS. Anger building... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek DANGLES like a spider over the PILE OF TREASURE. Belo the GUARDS are distracted by the show... But a PORTLY PRI hovers over the gifts, cataloguing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek scoops a fingerful of accumulated DUST from atop a column... Lets it DRIFT DOWN... The Portly Priest SNEEZES... giving Bek the chance to silently DROP behind the treasure. Bek fills his pockets with jewelry. But there’s only so much he can carry... Bek’s eyes a fancy CHARIOT... It’ll fit the bill nicely.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: The “Set” actor WINS, pinning the “Osiris” actor beneath boot. CELEBRATION ERUPTS at “Set’s victory.” The God of Virility BRAYS. A fine show, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: HOODED HORUS
dialogues.text: Has seen enough. He takes a step toward the throne... A HAND clamps down on Horus’ shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: (voice low) This is what he wants. It's Wepwawet. Also disguised. Horus is surprised to see him -- and irritated to be caught by his teacher.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here while we can. With a colossal act of will, Horus FOLLOWS Wepwawet away.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: On his throne. His eyes searching the crowd, disappointed

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Oh well. Guess you’1l have to wait another ten years.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I’m not finished. Set steps INTO THE COURTYARD. The audience watches with bated breath... as Set circles the trembling “Osiris.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (addressing all present) It is important that the manner of Osiris’ death be known... That the scribes mark the record true. The Actor “Osiris” weeps with fear, GROVELLING at Set’s f

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Osiris begged before dying.

dialogues.speaker: ON HORUS AND WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Horus stops in his tracks. Seething...

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Keep walking...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Touches the “Osiris” Actor... The man DRIES into a mummif husk, shrivelling like salt poured on a slug. The body tu to dust. Same fate as the cursed slave at the Obelisk...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: No King of Egypt should beg.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Is pushed to the limit. He throws off his cloak, uncoveri a clutch of SPEARS --

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Don’t --

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Senses something --

dialogues.speaker: A SPEAR
dialogues.text: STREAKS at him like a missile. It creases Set’s ear, as h barely DODGES out of the way -- The God of Virility, however, is PINNED TO A PILLAR. Horus strides into the courtyard, SPEAR in each fist... T eyes of Osiris’ son burn with vengeance. A hush falls...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Today I bring truth. Today I avenge my father for the evil done to him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON BEK. Seeing Horus in the flesh for the first time, he can’t help but be in awe. ON THE NOBLES. Whispering in fear, “He’s come.” ON THE LESSER GODS. Nervous they’ve chosen the wrong side ON THE LOWER CLASSES, peering in from outside. Their savi is here. ON HATHOR. She catches Horus’ eye. There’s history here. He sees her as an enemy. She doesn’t see him that way -- won't let it show. Set grips his SCEPTER, a deadly 5,000 pound iron monstros

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I was hoping my nephew was coming to swear his eternal devotion. (a half smile, to Horus) It’s not too late to bow before me.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I’1l bow to your dust. It begins. Their WEAPONS CLANG loud as a thousand swords.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (genuinely impressed) I mistook your absence for cowardice. But you’ve been practicing. Lesser gods JUMP ASIDE. Mnevis draws his sword halfway... then stops. All afraid of Horus.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to the lesser gods) Now, later... it doesn't matter. Horus ferociously CHARGES -- sends Set BACKPEDALING into

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST OF PILLARS
dialogues.text: Bek SCAMPERS UP A PILLAR like a monkey to get out of the way... Priests and Nobles run hither and thither... Horus SHOULDERS PILLARS ASIDE like a battering ram... The gods’ fierce duel takes them RIGHT BELOW BEK. His high perch TOTTERS like a gargantuan bowling pin... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bek LEAPS onto another pillar. Safe until a mighty swing Set’s scepter CRACKS that pillar, too.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Oh come on. High above the clashing titans, Bek BOUNDS from pillar to pillar as they fall like dominoes... Bek eyes the CHARIOT OF TREASURE below -- at least the go combat scattered the Soldiers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek SLIDES DOWN a tipping pillar like a ramp... HOPS A RI on another pillar about to grind him to a pulp... .».-and drops TO THE FLOOR, next to the Chariot.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Loses sight of Set in the maze of Pillars... Now he hunts But every time he has a bead on Set, he’s GONE the second Horus STRIKES. Set is everywhere and nowhere...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I thought your sight was perfect, but you aim like a drunk.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: God of Confusion, I can see everything. HORUS’ P.O.V. Looking through the pillars with X-RAY VISI Sees multiple Sets -- but only one casts _a_shadow. His vision focuses to a narrow beam, pinpointing his target - Horus THROWS. The SPEAR flies true -- It punches through two pillars on its way to Set, STRIKIN HIM IN THE CHEST. Set FALLS. The CROWD GASPS. Nobles, in horror. The poor, exultantly.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Die god of rot. Your body will be given to the cats, and the offal cast to the reptiles. But Set RISES, very much alive. SNAPS the spear.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (stunned) Why aren't you dead? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have practiced more. ON HORUS. It makes no sense. Frustration fans his anger.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: STRAPS the Chariot’s BRIDLE around his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Second thing I’m going to buy is a horse... Bek hears an inhuman screech. He thought he’d seen it all Horus transforms into a GREAT FALCON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set responds by becoming the massive, four-legged JACKAL- CREATURE. Wings beating, the Falcon digs CLAWS into its f Bek DUCKS as the god-beasts GRAPPLE... It’s only a matter moments before the whole temple collapses. Bek PULLS the chariot like a mule, teeth gritted -- but t Portly Priest and two SOLDIERS block his way.

dialogues.speaker: PORTLY PRIEST
dialogues.text: You're a thief.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: And you're a priest. (looks him in the eye) The question is, which one of us is more committed to his job? A chunk of stone HITS right beside them. The Portly Pries and Soldiers RUN. So much for commitment. Bek throws his weight into the bridle as pillars SMASH DO all around him. He HEAVES the Chariot, threads the needle

dialogues.speaker: OUT OF THE PALACE
dialogues.text: As the whole structure comes CRASHING DOWN. Bek made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the wreckage, the Jackal-Creature CLAMPS its on the Falcon and FLINGS it into the giant PALACE GATE. The Falcon TRANSFORMS back to HORUS, getting his bearings The impact CRACKED the GATE... If it falls, it’1ll hit Be chariot of treasure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bek sees a NOBLEWOMAN near Horus, her dress pinned by RUB

dialogues.speaker: NOBLEWOMAN
dialogues.text: (to Horus) Help me... Horus RUSHES Set, oblivious to the Noblewoman and her fat The stone gate TEETERS -- she’s sure to be crushed -- Bek makes a split-second decision. He pulls the Noblewoma OUT OF THE WAY as the Gate starts to FALL...

dialogues.speaker: NOBLEWOMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, kind sir -- But Bek’s already RUNNING BACK to the chariot. LUGS IT ou of the way in the nick of time as the Gate HITS -- The Noblewoman pats at her throat. Her NECKLACE is missin

dialogues.speaker: BEK IN THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Casually tosses the necklace he just stole into the chari adding it to the rest of his treasure.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: In human form again, backs down the avenue lined with towering GOLDEN STATUES of Ra. Baiting Horus to follow...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: With no father to protect you, your mother came to me one night. Willing to do anything to keep you safe... Anything at all...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Shut up... As Horus’ fury grows, heat distorts the air around him...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Which, it turned out, was quite a lot.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Shut _up. As super-heated Horus pursues his enemy, cloth banners BU INTO FLAME at his passing... Set smirks as Horus gets angrier and angrier. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Wrath thy name is Horus. And by thy name undone. Horus feels a DROP on his shoulder. It’s MOLTEN GOLD. The giant golden statues are MELTING from Horus’ heat. Th crumple like soft wax on top of him... He’s KNOCKED DOWN the weight... Set STRIKES him with the full might of his scepter. Horus FLIES BACK in a spray of liquid gold -- Horus STRUGGLES to rise, but Set HAMMERS him... until Hor lies defeated. Set reaches down... And PLUCKS out both of Horus’ EYES. Horus’ eyes appear as JEWELS glinting magically in Set’s fist. A theft of Horus’ very essence.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (addressing the crowd) Even though I was provoked, Horus still lives. I am Set the merciful. Horus CRAWLS AWAY, BLINDED... gold running like a stream around him... ON HATHOR. A thousand emotions flash across her face befo she successfully feigns disinterest... ON WEPWAWET. His worst fears have come to pass. THE CROWD is stunned. Even Set’s faithful are staggered b what’s transpired. For the Lower Classes, all hope is gon

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is why praying’s a waste of time. Bek COVERS his treasure with a torn banner and ROLLS IT A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dense forest. Horus CRAWLS, seeing only with his fingertips... his eyes BLINDFOLDED with torn cloth.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to the North Winds) Father... I failed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus pounds the ground in frustration. Trees tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A HAMMER brought down on an ANVIL -- each blow bright as a meteor strike. A HELMET has been forged. The metal glows red as blood spilled by hate. Set admires his handiwork... and fits ON JEWELED EYE of Horus into the faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Finally. The Right Eye of Horus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wepwawet follows a TRAIL OF DESTRUCTION, accompanied by S OTHER GODS in the form of athletic men and women... Allie of Horus. They see crops flattened. Boulders split. A granary reduc to rubble. Like a tornado cut a path through the farmland FARMERS hurry past, fleeing the source of the mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Turn back. He’s mad... Horus’ Allies keep following the trail... They find Horus on the move, blindly swinging his fists. Horus rips off branches, stiff-arms trunks into SPLINTERS. His eyes wrapped with a BLINDFOLD torn from his tunic.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Easy, Horus... Horus HALTS, recognizing the voice. There’s nowhere to go anyway. Hot, impotent rage withers the grass at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: My anger did not defeat me. (baffled) He withstood a mortal blow from my spear... I don’t know how. Wepwawet does not want to provoke him by arguing the poin

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: Set’s trickery is famed. Wepwawet presses a bottle into Horus’ hand. Horus takes a drink. It calms him an iota. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotion pl ON HORUS. Wepwawet, 25.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: She was with him. And I doubt she was tricked. ays across Horus’ face at the thought of Hathor.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: You're always in Hathor’s heart, you know.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Yes, she’s got a big heart. Room enough for a crowd in there.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: The Goddess does what she needs to survive Set’s rule... And we will do what we need to end it. Despair sets in.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The last thing I saw was the face of my father’s murderer. Now it’s all I’l1l ever see.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: I’ve learned one of your eyes is secured in his treasury. We’re going to steal it back. steely-eyed, stands ready. His six Comrades, too.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (that’s madness) Set’s treasury is surrounded by deadly traps no god can pass. You told me that.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: (gathering his courage) Any trap that can be sprung can be dodged. It’s time I tested my mettle against Set’s.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: It’s too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: In all the years we've been friends, when has it ever been safe?  26. EXT. FOREMAN’S PAVILION - GREAT OBELISK - DAY Set observes the countless slaves building his Great Obel As he walks into the massive shadow it casts, the structu unfinished tip eclipses the SUN...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: (off the Obelisk) No one has so honored the great god Ra, who rises on the horizon day by day.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I’m sure my father will find this pile of stone a worthy substitute for the son I killed. Set squints up at the sun... then turns to Urshu.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You only have three days before the sun is at its closest... The Obelisk must be finished by then.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: It will be. Ra will pass by its high peak and marvel at the greatness you have built in his name.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Truthfully, I honor myself as well. (ordering him) You will entomb these slaves within the Obelisk upon its completion. Urshu does not pause at the impending mass murder...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: It will be their honor to serve you even in death.

dialogues.speaker: THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Bek overhears, alarmed. In rich man’s clothes, waiting beside his treasure-laden chariot for an audience with Ur

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Many of these mortals worshipped Horus. They will die with their prayers unanswered. ON BEK. He has got to get Zaya out of here, now.  27. INT. OFFICE - FOREMAN’S PAVILION - LATER Urshu’s busy going over the plans with his Engineers... H Guards bring “wealthy” Bek before him...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I’m here to purchase one of your servants.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: I can’t spare any.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Urshu sees the CHARIOT in the courtyard, full of treasure Can’t help but be impressed. He gestures to his SERVANTS.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: Pick one and leave. But Bek doesn’t see Zaya among them...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Don’t you have one with green eyes? At this, Urshu and the GUARDS exchange a look...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: (cool, to the Head Guard) Fetch her. While they’re waiting, Urshu gets conversational...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: You're a man of wealth. Have you had much problem with thieves?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Just have to be smarter than them.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: I’ve found evidence of an intruder. But I could find nothing stolen. Bek doesn’t like where this is headed... especially when sees that GUARDS have blocked the windows and doors.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: So I had the place searched again, not to see if anything was missing... but to see if anything unusual could be found. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Urshu holds up Zaya’s HORUS FIGURINE for Bek to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zaya’s DRAGGED IN by Guards, her clothes dirty and torn.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Zaya -- Zaya’s terrified. Urshu strokes her cheek...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: As if using my home for your fornicating wasn’t sufficient. (off her figurine) This didn’t save you, did it? Set is your god. Guards with DRAWN SWORDS encroach on Bek... Bek grabs Urshu’s ARCHITECTURAL PLANS -- Holds the plans one hand, a burning LAMP in the other...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Be a shame if our beloved god's obelisk wasn’t finished on time. Urshu signals his Guards to MOVE AWAY FROM THE DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: (nonchalant, to Bek) Take her, then. Zaya SNATCHES her HORUS FIGURINE off the floor... She and Bek BOLT OUT, tossing the plans once they’re clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek and Zaya RUN through the construction site, teeming w activity... Soldiers CONVERGE... AHEAD, two massive BLOCKS OF STONE, big as boxcars, are b pushed toward each other, the gap between them CLOSING FA Bek and Zaya DASH THROUGH THE NARROWING GAP a moment befo they would've been crushed. The Soldiers ARE CUT OFF, for the moment. Bek and Zaya reach

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN GATE
dialogues.text: The SENTRIES here haven't been alerted yet...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We can make it -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Just you. Zaya STOPS and pulls up her sleeve, revealing the brand o Set. She can never leave.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (with a grim smile) It stings a little. Bek reels...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: I‘1l manage...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (off the Obelisk) They’re going to kill the slaves soon as that thing’s done.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (shaken) How long?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Three days. (impotent fury) I’ll break the curse. I/‘11 kill Set myself.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (unwavering) You can’t. Only Horus can.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: He fought like a fool and now he’s blind.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: You always said you can steal anything... (presses the Figurine in Bek’s hand) Steal his eye. Give it back to him. The Soldiers are CLOSING IN, led by Urshu...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: It’s the only way you can save me.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I’m not putting my faith in him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zaya gives Bek a kiss goodbye -- a lifetime of passion pressed into seconds --

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: We'll argue about it later. Before Bek can stop her, Zaya runs into the clutches of t Soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BEK. Slipping THROUGH THE GATE to freedom... He feels like his guts have been ripped open. INT. SET’S TREASURE VAULT A vast CHAMBER. Pillars, walls, ceiling -- every surface METAL polished to a shine. Austere as a bank. A SHORT GUARD ENTERS, carrying a covered birdcage. It’s B in disguise. ON BEK. Focused. He won’t let Zaya down. Turning a corner, he sees the last thing he expected -- a the GUARDS are sprawled dead on the floor. Bek peers over the EDGE OF THE BALCONY... A DEEP ROOM the size of a football field. Endless GOLD BA from wall to wall. The wealth of a god in ordered stacks. A LONG BRIDGE traverses the cavernous vault. Bek’s eyes a drawn to something among the treasure UNDER THE BRIDGE... A groaning BODY. It’s Wepwawet, dying. The other SIX GODS lie dead among the gold. Wepwawet got furthest, which isn’t very far at all.

dialogues.speaker: WEPWAWET
dialogues.text: You're not a guard...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Tell me about the traps. What killed you? Wepwawet EXPIRES before he can answer. As a test, Bek TOSSES his helmet OVER THE BALCONY -- The helmet hits the floor of gold bricks... the bricks MO attacking the helmet with STINGERS -- Underneath every brick lies a SCORPION, plump with venom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: When the Scorpions realize there’s no flesh within the helmet, they rearrange themselves into neat rows, carryin the Bricks on their backs. You’d never know they were the Bek scans the multitude of bricks with a shudder...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Where do you even get that many scorpions? The bridge is divided into THREE SPANS. The closest is ma of SILVER. The next span is GOLD. The last he can’t see. Bek swallows hard... and considers the first hurdle: THE FIRST SPAN -- THE BRIDGE OF SILVER. Metal STATUES OF SET as a Jackal-Creature line the bridge both sides, facing each other at ten foot intervals. To cross you have to walk past them. It’s unnerving. Bek removes the hood from his CAGE. Frees a pair of PIGEO Bek FLICKS a handful of BIRDSEED along the bridge... Watc the pigeons HOP along the tiles, PECKING -- The birds SPRING THE TRAP. Two statues of Set facing each other FLEX their METAL ARMS -- pulling a RAZOR SHARP WIRE taut between them. The pigeons COO, unscathed. It would have cut a man in ha

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Be a mess to clean up. The trap RESETS. Pressure-sensitive floor-tiles? Maybe that’s what he’s supposed to think... Bek looks closer... ON BEK. So that’s Set’s secret:

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to a pigeon) It’s a bait-and-switch. Set doesn't think like a god. He thinks like a criminal. Bek notes the BIRD SHADOWS cast by the light of a BURNING BRAZIER... SNAP. It’s the bird’s shadow that triggers the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek LIGHTS a torch... Holds it out in front of him to ERA THE SHADOW... And is able to cross the first span... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND SPAN
dialogues.text: Also lined with Statues of Set -- but these grip long cur DAGGERS. Bek throws more seed. The pigeons trot over to eat it... Nothing happens until they FLUTTER INTO THE AIR -- The entire Bridge of Gold FOLDS IN ON ITSELF like a bear trap. The statues’ daggers slice together like giant scissors. The pigeons flit up out of danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge clanks OPENS, trap RESET. But what triggered i Bek sees a PIGEON FEATHER dancing on an unseen WIND... Bek grinds a handful of birdseed into a fine POWDER under heel... and BLOWS it into the AIR... revealing: A _crisscrossing web of nearly invisible LINES -- jets of blowing in all directions from the Statues’ mouths. If anything disrupts their stream, the trap is sprung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek BLOWS clouds of seed powder in front of him... naviga the maze of air “tripwires,” as he CROSSES THE SECOND SPA THE THIRD SPAN -- THE BRIDGE OF MAGIC. Built of BLACK STONE. Obsidian Statues of Set line the bridge, each holding an OBJECT of wonder and magic... A FEATHER OF THE PHOENIX, exquisite as a rainbow. The SKY NECKLACE OF SHU, made of cloud. A TAMARISK SAPLING, bare withered. A GOBLET filled with milk from the breast of Nu A GEMSTONE bright as the noonday sun. The Eye of Horus.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: That’s it. Bek tosses a handful of birdseed... but the pigeons are hesitant to go further, spooked.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: This is how you thank me for all the meals we’ve shared? Bek SPRINTS full bore down the bridge... SWATTING magic items off the statues as he passes -- TRAPDOORS open in front of each magic item as he KNOCKS T OFF... But Bek’s moving fast, one step ahead. He doesn't fall in -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Feather flutters down... The Necklace floats away... Running, Bek GRABS the Eye of Horus. He’s going to make i In front of him, a thirsty PIGEON lands on the Goblet of Milk...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Oh no -- The pigeon TIPS OVER the goblet, tripping the trapdoor. Which is, unfortunately, right under Bek. Bek FALLS --

dialogues.speaker: DOWN INTO THE VAULT
dialogues.text: Bek SLAMS onto gold bricks... Hears thousands of tiny leg skittering... Shuts his eyes and waits for stinging death But death does not come. Bek opens his eyes... A MASS OF SCORPIONS surround Bek, stingers raised... all at bay by the glowing Eye of Horus in his hand. The scorpions RETREAT from the light in a polluted tide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek looks at the Eye warming his palm... and triumphantly closes his fist over his prize. EXT. CANYON - SET’S TREASURE VAULT - DAY Bek EXITS the vault, making haste down the CANYON protect Set’s treasury... The Eye GLOWS in Bek’s hand...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are my allies? A SPEAR swings out of the shadows -- Bek barely DUCKS -- Blind Horus EMERGES from behind a boulder, smoldering lik volcano... Tracking Bek with keen ears.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: They’re all dead. The news is like a knife through Horus. It can’t be true.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You've got my eye. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: It was there for the taking. I took it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: No mortal could rob Set’s vault. You must have pilfered my eye from Wep’s corpse...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: He never even got close. Horus STRIKES again, smashing a rock. It’s only because t god is blind -- and Bek is quick -- that Bek survives.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Stop. I have a proposition --

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You dare bargain with me for what is mine? Horus JABS AGAIN. Bek dodges.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You're lucky I’m willing to. You can’t hit a thing.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He was the god of stealth. I knew of no one braver or more loyal. (dismissive) What are you? Some thief?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Some thief.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You want a reward I suppose? Gold?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Gold I can steal. (beat) There’s a slave I want freed.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: A lot of work for a slave.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I’m dedicated. She’s been cursed by Set. ON HORUS, cooling. He lowers his spear...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: And cursed she will be until Set’s death. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (holds out his palm) Seems we want the same thing. So give me my Eye.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I only have three days.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Three days?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Set won’t need slaves after he finishes his little construction project. And he kills what he doesn’t need.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I trained ten years for my first battle with Set -- and still I was not ready. Maybe twenty more --

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I don’t have twenty years. I don’t have a week. I have three days.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: It can’t be done.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (edge of desperation) Well figure it out. (off the Eye) Or maybe I should toss this in the Nile.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Wait. thinking.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Did you really sneak past Set’s traps or was that an idle boast?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I boast, but I don’t lie.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (mind working) Wep and I would sit up at night... talking of all the ways to kill that dung-eater. There was one mad plan, born of an excess of wine... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But even Wep did not have the skill. (to Bek) Today you did what he could not. Maybe tomorrow you can do more.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I will kill Set in three days -- if you assist me. ON BEK. He wasn’t expecting to actually work with Horus..

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: My eye, mortal. Do we have an agreement?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: My name is Bek. Bek tosses the eye to Horus -- who pops it back in his he with a BURST OF LIGHT. Horus can see again, his empty soc still covered with the strip of cloth. Horus is able to look Bek up and down for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You're small, Bek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek and Horus are in a secluded, rocky place. The two unlikely allies warily taking stock of each other.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The God of the Desert will die if we destroy the desert itself.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: All of it?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Why, are you fond of sand? (beat ) Within Set’s temple is the Fire that is the source of his power. Extinguish that, and he fades away. The whole of the Nile could not quench that fire... But a few drops from the waters of creation can. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will fly to the heavens and collect some from the prow of Ra’s boat. Bek raises an eyebrow. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: That’s a good job for you.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Plainly. (continuing) However, Set’s Fire is guarded by the Sphinx. ON BEK. Worried. He’s heard the stories...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You know the answer to its riddle?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: It'll tear us to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Which is why the second thing we must do is convince the God of Wisdom to answer it for us. (beat) A formidable task in its own right.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: So what do you need me for?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The hardest job of all. (beat) Set’s pyramid of sand is ten times the challenge his treasury is. Guarded by the deadliest traps he’s devised. Walls, floors, nothing stays still. Always moving. Made of crushing sand and stone.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: A maze only the cleverest thief could conquer.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I will settle for you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus and Bek CREST A RIDGE. A panoramic view of the land In the distance, a malevolent strip of red: the Desert.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Set will hunt us every step of the way.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Let him. Horus likes that answer. He looks at the SUN, low on the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Keep out of trouble until I return. I go to collect water from creation or die in the doing. Horus TRANSFORMS into a Falcon and TAKES TO THE SKY -- Bek watches Horus FLY AWAY... Wondering what he’s gotten himself into. EXT. NEPHTHYS’ STRONGHOLD - SUNSET A mountain-top Aerie... UNDER SIEGE from Set’s SOLDIERS. Arrows fill the air, shooting down BIRDS trying to escape

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (to his Archers, off the birds) Do not let a single messenger escape. INT. NEPHTHYS’ STRONGHOLD - SUNSET POUNDING at the gate...

dialogues.speaker: NEPHTHYS
dialogues.text: Is cornered. 40s, plain-faced. The Goddess of Weavers. He great feathered WINGS are folded against her back. Great doors BREAK OPEN under a withering assault. Set RUS IN, flanked by his Soldiers. They engage a DOZEN GOD BODYGUARDS in fierce HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT. The Bodyguards flash various animal heads in the melee, b none of them can withstand Set’s mighty scepter. Nephthys shrinks back from Set, afraid but defiant... Set picks at a length of LINEN spilling from a loom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Is it right that a goddess should perform such labor? They clearly have a past. They were once husband and wife before the death of Osiris.

dialogues.speaker: NEPHTHYS
dialogues.text: Since you became king, the need for burial shrouds has been great.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (brushes back her hair) You could have been a queen.

dialogues.speaker: NEPHTHYS
dialogues.text: Your brother was already married. Set fumes at the mention of Osiris, forever jealous.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: What if I told you I would pardon you for leaving me at my moment of triumph? You could wear the crown that is your right.

dialogues.speaker: NEPHTHYS
dialogues.text: (coldly) After all the years we shared, you should already know my answer.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: That makes this much easier. Set rips ONE OF NEPHTHYS’ WINGS from her body -- it clatt to the ground as GOLD. Nephthys looks to Set in horror. This is unthinkable. She uselessly flaps her remaining WING in a pathetic corkscre attempt at escape, CRASHING back to the ground... Set TEARS OFF Nephthys’ other wing. She sinks to the floo listless but conscious.

dialogues.speaker: NEPHTHYS
dialogues.text: (weakly, off her wings) You would rob me of my very essence... The others won’t stand for this.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: No one will know what’s happened here until it’s too late. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEPHTHYS
dialogues.text: (can’t understand) Why? You’re already king... Set keeps the answer to himself... The bullish god Mnevis ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: Lord. Your royal treasury has been breached.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: A mortal. The smell is unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What did he steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus the Falcon FLIES HIGH into the STRATOSPHERE... so h the curvature of the earth can be seen. From up here, the Nile’s blue line looks like the artery of creation. Above, through a break in the clouds... A magnificent SAILING SHIP cruising at the edge of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RA’S BOAT. Its hull and splendid sails of purest gold. A titanic CHAIN rises from the ship’s deck into the heavens Ra’s boat pulls THE SUN itself around the Earth each day. Horus the Falcon pushes himself higher... INTO THE CLOUDS The air here is TURBULENT... for this is the chaotic, primordial stuff from the time before creation... Gusts t violently at Horus the Falcon, throwing him back... The wind strips feathers from his wings, threatening to r him apart... Battered, he FALLS... Plummeting to earth, Horus retakes the FORM OF A MAN, stu like a pugilist...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Father, let your strength be mine. Still falling, Horus finds it within himself to press on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I am the Lord of the Sky. I will enter the celestial waters -- Horus TRANSFORMS back into a Falcon and redoubles his efforts, again thrusting into the CLOUDS... +.-until, with a final burst of strength, he BREAKS THROU EXT. RA’S BOAT The Falcon LANDS on the deck, TRANSFORMING back into Horu What looks like a man in his 50s sits sharpening his SPEA a GRINDSTONE... Sparks spit and pop off the shining blade Battle-scars mark his sinewy body. Deep crows-feet line e fierce as a storm. He is

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Lord of the Cosmos. Majestic and mighty, moral and wise. does not look up as Horus drops to a knee and bows.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Hail, thou Great God Ra.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Normally when a bird lands on my boat uninvited I kill it before it can shit.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Forgive me, grandfather. I would only ask something of you...

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: In that case I’ll stop what I’m doing and heed your bidding.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I mean no disrespect --

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You don’t know the difference. Ra’s keen eyes plumb the SHADOW brewing on the HORIZON...

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Sit and be silent. I have work to do. Ra CRANKS a massive WINCH... Letting out miles and miles the mighty chain... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Sun, thus released, DIPS below the horizon... Ra’s boat passes into NIGHT... A chill wind whips the sails... Horus finds his knees weakened by dread... A SHADOW uncoils from the abyss, size beyond imagining...

dialogues.speaker: APOPHIS
dialogues.text: Rises like a thunderhead... The Demon of Chaos. Defined b blackness, its gargantuan silhouette is REPTILIAN... Ra stands tall on the ship’s bow... and readies a SPEAR glittering with cosmic power. Apophis ROARS -- The demon’s TAIL, wide as a cyclone, SMACKS the hull -- Horus is THROWN against the mast, grabs on for dear life. Ra_answers with stabs of WHITE FIRE from his spear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apophis’ head opens like a mile-long red chasm... reveali MOUTH wide enough to swallow Ra’s boat... It seems to Hor wide enough to swallow the whole world... Ra stands his ground, STRIKING the beast in the darkness. Apophis’ ear-spitting HOWL rocks the boat as their duel SHAKES THE FIRMAMENT...

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Crawl back to shadow, you stinking worm. A final jab of his spear... and Apophis SHRINKS BACK into black primordial sea...

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You shall not feast on creation. (beat) Until tomorrow, at least. Ra leans against his spear, tired... As his boat SAILS on beautiful canopy of STARS envelops them. Ra uncorks a jug of wine and drinks with gusto. Enjoying taste of life the way only one who faces death can. Horus shows his respect with silence.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You know when to keep quiet.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: There are no words for that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see how heavily Ra’s burden weighs upon him.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: How different things would be if I could dwell amongst my children in the garden of the Nile... Instead it is my burden to fight the demon Apophis night after night. So that Egypt is not destroyed by chaos. (pointed) There are things worse than Set.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You'd say that? Even after what you've just witnessed?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: That demon isn’t the one who murdered my father, your son.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: They are both my sons. Speak to me in that tone again boy, and I will slap you into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Allow me to fill my flask with these waters.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: (considers this) The waters are not mine. Horus leans over the side of the hull and dips his flask the WATER OF CREATION. Water, but not water... Air, but n air... It sparks with life as it flows into the container

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You plan to quench the desert fire? Bold. But if you kill Set, you will be king. How will you rule?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I don’t plan to rule at all. Ra frowns.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: How did you get your eye back? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: A mortal.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Intrepid of him.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He had the gall to strike a bargain with me. But I need him to break into Set’s Temple of Sand.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: He will surely die there.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: There are many sacrifices on the path to vengeance.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Does he know he’s one of them?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He’s a mortal. He doesn't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: I had hopes for you. But all you want is revenge. Ra turns away from Horus in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: I do not approve of Set or how he rules Egypt. But I don’t know that you would be much better. (terse) Now get off my boat. T — DAY Bek RUNS for his life through THICK FOREST... Mnevis and a gang of FOUR BRUTISH BULL GODS (in their hum form) are hot on his tail. Bek ZIGZAGS through trees... but his pursuers CUT HIM OFF Mnevis SEIZES Bek, dangles him inches from his slimy snou

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: (sniffs him) Found you. Where is the Eye of Horus? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Up your behind, alongside the goat you keep there. Mnevis slams Bek against a tree.

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: I’ve seen all the ways a man can die. Fast, slow, dirty, clean. Mnevis presses the tip of a NASTY BLADE under Bek’s ribs.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I choose fast, but I’1l settle for clean.

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: Where is the Eye of Horus?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (from off-screen) Right here. Horus walks into the middle of the Bull Gods... Holds his spear like a bolt of lightning.

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: (surprised) I thought you were crawling sightless in the mud somewhere. Mnevis RELEASES Bek. The Bull Gods exchange uneasy glances... Even five against one, this is Horus.

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: (mustering his courage) Cut him down. The Bull Gods CHARGE Horus, blades drawn -- Horus JABS at Mnevis, but something’s off. He’s not as fa Mnevis BRINGS HIS SWORD down on Horus’ spear shaft -- KNO the weapon out of Horus’ hand. Surrounded, Horus ROLLS to recover his weapon -- DEFLECTS strikes, but a third SLASHES HIS RIBS... Gods don’t bleed but their wounds shine, raw and real. Horus WINCES...

dialogues.speaker: MNEVIS
dialogues.text: See, brothers. Without his other eye he is weak... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bek watched Horus bring down a stone temple like it was m of twigs. What’s wrong with him now? Horus backs into a defensive stance BETWEEN TWO TREES. Th first Bull God attacks, overeager -- Horus SHOULDERS him against a tree trunk, PINNING HIM as A second Bull God strikes... Horus spins the second attac into the first. A WET SLICING SOUND... and both COLLAPSE. Horus made them stab each other. Horus levels his gaze at Mnevis and the two remaining Bul Gods, who feel cold fear spread through their guts.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Even if I was blind... Horus TRIPS the Bull God to Mnevis’ left, who SLAMS flat his back -- Mnevis’ sword stroke MISSES Horus...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Deaf... Horus THRUSTS upward two-handed, delivering a LETHAL BLOW the Bull God on Mnevis’ right --

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: And bereft of limbs... BELLOWING, Mnevis SLASHES at Horus again, hitting only ai

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: --.-I’m still a match for you. Horus JAMS his SPEAR through Mnevis’ chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE BEHIND HORUS. The last surviving Bull God GETS UP.. Because of his EYE PATCH, Horus can’t see him coming --

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (warning him) Horus --— Horus WHIPS AROUND and SLAYS the last Bull God.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You have a blind spot. There’s no “thank you for saving me” forthcoming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I told you to do one thing. Stay alive until I got back.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Last time I saw you fight you were knocking down pillars like they were nothing. Now you need me to keep you from getting skewered? Are you sure you can do this? Horus turns on Bek in fury... The troubling implications his newfound weakness is not something Horus wants to fac

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The only reason I saved you, mortal, is you are useful to me. Don’t test my patience. Bek sees the hypnotically swirling Water of Creation in Horus’ flask...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: That’s really Water of Creation?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: What would happen if I drank it?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You would be refreshed. And then you would die.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: It doesn’t seem right that the Water of Creation would kill.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I would kill you. For wasting my water.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Now that we’ve got it, let’s go get our answer from the God of Wisdom. We only have two days left.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: We may have less time than that... Worried, Horus scans the world for miles in every directi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The roads will be watched now... (off Mnevis’ body) And Set will send better hunters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set sits on his throne. Hathor at his side looks bored. Dead Mnevis and the Bull Gods are lined up on display. ANAT and ASTARTE Poke at the bodies, examining the wounds... Two warrior goddesses. Exotic beauties, 20s. Quick-tempered Astarte wears a wicked helmet topped with horns of a bull. Anat’s clad in panther skin, battle axe the ready -- she’s calculating and sadistic.

dialogues.speaker: ANAT
dialogues.text: (off the bodies) This one dropped his guard... This one must have misjudged his speed... This one badly missed a side-stroke... And these two killed each other.

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: Too bad for them you didn’t summon us sooner. ON SET. Brooding on the return of his enemy.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I didn't know Horus had his sight back.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (to Set, off Anat and Astarte) Why bring this trash into your home? They’re only worshipped by cannibals and rapists. Astarte kicks her spear to Hathor’s exquisitely shod feet inviting a fight. Hathor toes it away, declining the offe

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: As I thought.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (to Hathor) The desert is my home. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Anat and Astarte) Find Horus and you may keep his remaining eye. I have the only piece of him I need.

dialogues.speaker: ANAT
dialogues.text: We will deliver him to you.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: No. Incinerate him, along with the thief. ON HATHOR. A distressing thought, but she can’t let it sh

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (to Hathor) Unless you want to see his face one last time?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Good hunting, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HORUS, WALKING briskly over rough ground and underbrus

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: We should be at Thoth’s library soon if... Horus stops, realizing he’s talking to nobody. Bek’s LAGGING BEHIND, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I need... to rest.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: We've only been travelling nine hours. Bek SITS, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You can fly.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Iocan. Can you?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Couldn’t you carry me? Horus doesn't dignify that with an answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus impatiently waits for Bek to recover... HORUS’ P.O.V. Locking onto a SAPLING a half a mile away. From this distance invisible to the human eye. Horus hefts his spear, AIMS AT THE SAPLING... But his vis isn’t crisp like it was. It wavers now, unstable... Horus lets the spear FLY with such speed the SONIC BOOM knocks Bek flat on his back -- The spear MISSES the sapling... ATOMIZING a massive tree. Bek doesn’t know it was a miss.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You don’t have to keep trying to impress me.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Wasn’t even close. ON HORUS. Doubt. A new feeling for him. He hates it. Horus sits straight-backed on a rock near a STREAM. He ha Bek a CUP from his belt...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: So you don’t have to bring me water cupped in your hands.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I’m not your slave.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: My father taught me it was unworthy of a god to smite a man.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: He should’ve taught you to get off your ass and get your own water. Horus BACKHANDS Bek INTO THE STREAM with a splash.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to the North Winds) Sorry, Father. As Bek CLIMBS OUT OF THE STREAM... the SMALL FIGURINE of Horus falls from Bek’s pocket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus considers the falcon-headed statue’s likeness...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The brow lacks majesty and the beak is crooked. (shrugs ) I’ve seen worse.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: It’s not mine. ON BEK. A stab of emotion as he thinks of Zaya...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Let’s go. We’re losing time. Horus can see Bek’s still exhausted...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You look weak.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (it occurs to him) I think you need food. Humans need food.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: What do you know about humans? Bek stubbornly keeps moving...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I insist. (gesturing) This land is bountiful. Eat. Bek relents. Not because he’s tired and hungry -- which h is -- but because he can’t help but be amused at this god doesn’t understand the first thing about men.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We don’t eat trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blur through branches... something moving fast... A CHARIOT pulled by a pair of HORSES with the speed of gods Astarte yanks the reins to halt the beasts -- the violenc the stop cuts a trench beneath their hooves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Anat steps from the chariot to push her hand into the ear They’re tracking Horus and Bek...

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: What do the worms tell you? WORMS wriggle to the surface in a line, pointing the way SMALL CITY ahead...

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: He’s close. Anat puts a wooden FLUTE to her lips. Plays a shrill NOTE Far away, a chilling sound like a LIVING WINDSTORM ANSWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hathor and Set recline on cushions, sipping wine... Discr Musicians play captivating MUSIC, promising sensual delig Hathor takes another hearty sip. Half-drunk. Trying to forget the past, anxious to reach sweet oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You're thirsty this evening.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: With wine this good, no excuse is necessary.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Your wine is always good. Set leans in to kiss her... Hathor smells something on hi

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (teasing) Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I can smell her on you.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Jealous of my hunters?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) I know that scent... Feathers and linen. Bland and boring. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (realizing) Why would you go see your former wife?

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I haven't seen Nephthys since the night she left me. ON HATHOR. She knows he’s lying. Her questioning was all fun -- but now she’s stumbled on something more. If Set suspects her, she’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (quickly covering) My mistake. (laughs it off) I can smell a woman on a man years later. Drives me crazy -- and my men too. Set nods, amused. Hathor gets up...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I‘1ll light incense --

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (pulls her back to him) Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hathor slips from Set’s bedchamber... Pads down the halls careful to stay out of sight from patrolling Guards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hathor ENTERS silently... Eerie shadows play off WEAPONS forged by Set... Hathor’s gripped by a wave of foreboding as she sees the ARMOR Set has been fashioning. The HELMET with Horus’ eye in the VISOR... and a BREASTPL with a JEWELED HEART.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Did you find what you were looking for? Set stands behind her, blocking the exit.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (off the breastplate) Osiris’ heart was never recovered. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: That’s why Horus couldn’t kill you... Hathor backs away from Set... and collides with Nephthys’ golden WINGS... She recoils from the dismembered parts...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: You're waging war on the gods? Set SEIZES her arm -- his touch starts to DECAY HER FLESH A jeweled BRACELET on Hathor’s wrist GLIMMERS SUPERNOVA- BRIGHT. Her skin HEALS as Set’s curse is repelled. Set shields his eyes -- the bracelet’s too bright to look Hathor SPRINTS out the door. She’s got a good head start, but she better keep running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus CONCEALS HIS FACE under the hood of a cloak... as h and Bek WALK through narrow, quiet alleys. Here and there SOLDIERS of Set keep watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek and Hooded Horus ENTER a working-class tavern.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (off Bek, to the Barkeep) Bring him some food. The BARKEEP raises an eyebrow at Horus’ imperious tone, b doesn’t recognize the god beneath his hood.

dialogues.speaker: BARKEEP
dialogues.text: To drink?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Your finest beer. Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to the Barkeep) I guess two. The Barkeep moves off...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to Horus) That’s not how mortals talk if they want good service. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I am used to more than service. I expect worship. Bek eats the food provided. Horus drinks from his cup.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to Horus) Do you even get thirsty?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I like the taste. Horus wipes his mouth with the back of his hand, raps his fist on the table. Satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to the Barkeep) This place pleases me. Ask, and find me generous.

dialogues.speaker: BARKEEP
dialogues.text: It's called paying. Horus pats his waistband... He has no money. Why would he

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (irritated) I’ve got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek and Hooded Horus cross a FIELD dotted with ROCK PILES This is where the poor are buried. They happen upon a POOR MAN’S FUNERAL. His linen-wrapped body is lowered into a simple pit. His WIFE weeps. The ma may not have been rich, but he was loved by many.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Bek, confused) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You’ve never seen a funeral?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I have. Not like this. This man takes nothing with him to the Afterlife. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Without treasure, he won’t be granted entry.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (terse) Not everyone has treasure. A grand funeral PROCESSION passes through, disrupting the Poor Man’s memorial... headed toward a city of low brick buildings: MASTABA TOMBS for the wealthy dead. Dozens of NOBLES and their SERVANTS transport a Rich Charioteer in his SARCOPHAGUS. They also carry a dazzling display of gold and jewels. The RICH CHARIOTEER’S WIFE is infuriated that their passa is being inconvenienced by the poor man’s funeral. RICH CHARIOTEER'’S WIFE (to the Poor Man's Wife) Only dogs lack the sense not to run out of the way of a chariot. At least my husband will not be troubled by dogs in the Afterlife.
