The Poor Man's Wife absorbs the insult. Horus is troubled. He approaches the POOR MOURNERS with h hood pulled low. They have no idea he is a god...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: POOR MOURNER
dialogues.text: Our friend was selling fish in the market, when a Rich Man’s chariot came galloping down the street -- didn't care who was in his way. He struck our friend and died himself when he was thrown. EXT. MASTABA TOMBS —- DAY Horus and Bek WALK ON... Mastaba Tombs in every direction Bek’s surprised to see Horus introspective...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: His murderer journeys to the Afterlife, but the poor man does not... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: This is the way things are down in the dirt with us mortals. Better to be a gold-plated bastard than a beggar full of charity. Dying’s a rich man’s game. (beat ) Why do you think I’m a thief? When I die -- many, many years from now by the way -- I plan to stroll into the Afterlife like him. Bek points back at the Rich Charioteer’s funeral processi ON HORUS, none of this seems quite right... The quiet is broken by the sound of the LIVING WINDSTORM.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (with a chill) What is that? Horus knows. He pulls Bek behind cover...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Get down -- or your plan to live many years will be ruined. HORUS’ P.O.V. Far-off, Anat and Astarte’s chariot... cutt like a streak across the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (grimly) Anat and Astarte. Set’s hunters. In the distance, a SPRAY OF FIRE rakes the farmers’ field A huge SHAPE UNDULATES WITHIN THE SMOKE... The source of terrifying windstorm sound.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: A pet of theirs. I can’t withstand its fire. (off his missing eye) Not as I am now... ON HORUS. At a loss what to do...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Then I guess we should run.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Run? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Mortals do it all the time. Horus and Bek ZIGZAG through the grid of SQUAT TOMBS... A hushed city of the dead, enfolding them like a maze...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We're going in circles. The WINDSTORM fills their ears, louder now... The pursuin creature getting closer... Bek and Horus hurry down a ROW OF TOMBS... A STREAM OF FI suddenly BLOCKS their way, close enough to curl the hair Bek’s eyebrows. They’ve run out of options... Horus and Bek hear ROCK SCRAPING ROCK behind them -- It's Hathor, standing in the DOORWAY of a SECRET PASSAGE. Bek can’t help but be captivated by her beauty.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Hello, my name is -- Horus’ good eye shoots daggers at Hathor.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Just shut up and come with me. Horus TURNS BACK to face the oncoming creature instead...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to Horus) I thought we were running away from the thing that burns up gods...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Its company is preferable.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (off Horus’ missing eye) You know you have no choice. You're half the god you used to be. ON HORUS. She’s right and he hates it. Horus FOLLOWS her

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE SECRET PASSAGE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) Lucky those bitches don’t know the history of this place. While he was constructing the tombs, the architect built a hidden passage here... so he could have secret liaisons with the Queen. They reach an UNDERGROUND RIVER. Hathor DIVES IN...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Uh, how long do I have to hold my breath? Horus DIVES IN, too. A BLAST OF FIRE cooks the passage. B JUMPS IN after them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coughing, waterlogged Bek trudges from the water... The underground river led to a SECLUDED LAGOON. Horus and Hathor wait on shore in chilly silence. Neither offers Bek a hand.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I’m still alive. No response. Bek flops down to rest. Hathor dips an empty wine sack in the WATER and magically TRANSFORMS it into WINE.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (off Horus’ missing eye) I think it makes you look roguish. It’s sure to become a trend. Hathor offers Horus some wine. A peace offering. He doesn take it. Bek reaches out his hand -- he’ll have some wine. Hathor ignores him like he doesn't exist. Typical.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (to Horus) You're welcome for saving you. Horus finally looks at her, furious.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Explain yourself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me like I’m your wife.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: So while I was crawling blind through a forest, you consorted with the god who pulled out my eyes? Hathor’s fingers trace the length of her curvy frame... Bek looks Horus take

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Why would I waste this on someone who can’t see?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You're a demon.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (playing with her hair) So you've said. For years.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I don’t know why you even bothered rescuing me. back and forth, trying to figure them out...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: He tore the wings off Nephthys... It was horrible. He’s forging some kind of armor. (after a beat) He kept your father’s heart. s in that appalling revelation...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: And now my eye. (gravely) He’s making a full suit of it then.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Why? He already has everything.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He wants to finish what he started. To humiliate and destroy all who championed my father. (beat) Once Set finishes his armor, he’1ll be too strong to stop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Does that change our plan?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: No. (to Hathor) We're breaking into Set’s desert temple to kill him once and for all. Hathor’s shocked. No one’s ever tried to do that before.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: How were you two jesters planning on getting in? Horus nods toward Bek...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (off Bek, it’s ridiculous) Him?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: After we see Thoth.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (unenthusiastic) Why would you ever do that on purpose?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Can you answer the riddle of the Sphinx?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek, Horus and Hathor SLOG thorough a SWAMP of tall, reed PAPYRUS PLANTS... Hathor lags, fatigued. She sips from he wine sack...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Not the best day to be hungover. Horus scoops her up and CARRIES her. Hathor doesn't complain. Bek smiles to himself. Horus won’t show it... but it’s obvious how much he cares about her.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You drink too much. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I’m the Goddess of Too Much. There’s plenty I’ve given you you’ve never found excessive. Horus can’t argue with that.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (to Bek) So why are you here? Are you seeking treasure?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I used to.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Never stop. (to Horus) When am I getting some?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Look to your wrist, if the effort is not too great. There you will see the Bracelet of Forty-Two Stars, one for each of the demons I slayed in the getting. To keep you safe from any curse. (pointed) To remind you of the one who gave it to you. Hathor admires her BRACELET. So does Bek. It sparkles lik the Big Bang.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: This old thing? Hathor drains the last of her wine... Still thirsty, she beckons Bek... Her eyes are mesmerizing...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Be a dear and fetch me something wet. There must be a pool of clean water somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (not seduced) You’re all the same, aren’t you? Hathor stares quizzically at Bek, who braces for her temper... But instead a genuine smile spreads over her fa (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (intrigued, excited) What’s her name?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I can make any man, woman, god or beast do my bidding -- unless their heart belongs to another. You’re in love.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He is?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Her name’s Zaya.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (chin cupped in her hands) Tell me everything.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We grew up in a nothing village. Maybe if we’d had more, the way people in the city do, I wouldn’t have noticed the little things... Like how just before the sun hid behind the mountains the light would catch her eyes... It was prettier than your bracelet. Hathor sighs, transported by Bek’s words...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: That was the first time you kissed her, wasn’t it? (backhands Horus) Why don’t you ever talk about me that way? Bek looks off, barely containing his emotion... ON HORUS. He’s risked death beside this mortal... and now realizes how little he knows him.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (hinting, to Horus) I’m still thirsty. Hathor WAVES AWAY Horus: give her a minute with Bek alone (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her gaze seems to plumb the depths of Bek’s heart.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We thought we needed more. So we ran away from home. Stupid. We had no idea how dangerous the world was. (beat) We were captured by slavers and crammed below the deck of a boat. I tried to break us free... But there were too many men with too Many swords. I went overboard, left for dead. Zaya stayed on the boat, in chains.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Now she’s one of the thousands building that hideous obelisk, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: This time, I’m going to save her.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I believe you will.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS NEARBY
dialogues.text: Has unearthed a spring. He kneels, filling Hathor’s wines with water... Bek approaches...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I didn’t know about your woman.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You didn't ask. (an awkward beat) With your eye, can you see her? Horus gazes at the horizon... HORUS’ P.O.V. Miles away, AT THE OBELISK... Zaya puts all her strength into inching a heavy stone forward... An OLD WOMAN SLAVE next to her drops in exhaustion... Zaya kindly helps the Older Woman to her feet before a CR OVERSEER notices. The Older Woman is thankful. They muste their strength to keep working... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: She has courage. Bek’s relieved Zaya’s alive. But he’s still afraid for he

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We have what, two days until Set sacrifices Zaya and all of them -- Why? Some piggish gesture?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: She'll be freed in time. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (sincere) You know, seeing her from so far away doesn't do her justice. You can’t hear her voice. Right now, she'd be saying “I told you so.” (off Horus’ questioning look) She’s the one who told me to trust you. Bek WALKS BACK to Hathor... ON HORUS, ALONE. Feeling guilty for using Bek, Horus poun the ground in frustration. Looks up at the sun...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (speaking quietly, to Ra) What would you have me do? I have no choice. I need him. A thicket of papyrus reeds PARTS -- A BABOON sticks his h out and SHRIEKS in surprise...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I guess we’re here. EXT. THOTH’S LIBRARY - DAY Busy BABOONS harvest papyrus, cut it into strips, beat it with mallets, press it under rocks. They’re making PAPER. THOTH’S LIBRARY stands beyond this assembly line. Stark, clean, and modern, it’s known as the “House of Life.” The DOORS are small as the baboons who stream in and out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I thought I was short...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The doors are for the baboons. Thoth never leaves. They bend down and SQUEEZE THROUGH the under-sized doors. Horus’ shoulders barely fit. He swears under his breath. INT. THOTH’S LIBRARY - DAY No windows -- just shelves lined with billions of SCROLLS Baboons CLIMB up and down, organizing all the world’s knowledge...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Hunches over a chaotic mess of scrolls. 20s, eccentric, socially awkward, convinced of his own genius. Fingers bl with ink, Thoth rapidly inscribes hieroglyphics... Baboon come and go, rolling and unrolling scrolls in front of hi

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Wise Lord of the Sacred Word, we come before you seeking counsel -- Thoth silences Horus with a raised finger... Finally, he looks up, impatient. Thoth shields his eyes from Hathor...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (to Hathor) You. Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: You prefer the view from behind?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (flustered) No, I... Yes. You know I can’t lie. I’m not going to risk looking at those tricky eyes of yours. Thoth turns to Horus, giving him his priceless attention.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I need --

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: The answer to the riddle of the Sphinx. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off Horus’ surprise) A child could deduce why you’re here. Thoth leans back in his chair, fingertips pressed togethe

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: I’m feeling magnanimous, so I’1l help you. Horus and Bek share a look. That was easy.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Go ask the riddle, then come back and relay it to me. I’11 solve it.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Uh, one of us would have to die...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Draw lots.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Come with us. The notion actually makes Thoth laugh.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Are you afraid you'll get it wrong?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Playing on my vanity? This is the cleverest strategy you could devise?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (still facing the wall) One night. I’11 give you one night.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Hathor) No, you won't. (turns back to Thoth) Set is forging some kind of armor made from the stolen essences of gods... What little vulnerability he has shrinks by the day. Thoth snorts. But behind his eyes, this information impac (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus’ ang 68. (2)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Set must be stopped before he eradicates us all. You see the wisdom in that... (no answer) Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (under his breath) I made a deal with him.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: What? er starts to SMOLDER...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Set doesn’t bother me, I don’t bother him. (explains) Study requires quiet. Set may keep the peace at the edge of a sword, but it is peace.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Cockroach. I’11 snap your neck.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (back to his studies) I have work to do. Horus’s uncontrolled rage sets scrolls on FIRE... Baboons rush to douse the flames...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Get out. Bek sees this has turned into a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I know something you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (noticing him) I thought you were one of the baboons...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (continuing) But you have to come with us to find out what it is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: I can recite the true names of the stars. I’ve seen the world created from sand and water. You think there is anything you know that I don’t?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: What does the sun feel like on your shoulders? ON THOTH. He doesn't know. EXT. THOTH’S LIBRARY - DAY Thoth looks up at the SKY... Dreary clouds hide the sun.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (grumbles, off Bek) It’s not even sunny... pfft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FOG settles... Horus, Bek, Hathor and Thoth WALK throug graveyard of once-great trees. The ground is grey, ruined forever. RUINS emerge from the fog like spectres... A giant statue OSIRIS lies on its side, its decapitated HEAD big as a wh To Horus, it feels as if his father’s eyes are judging hi Bek keeps pace alongside Horus, indifferent to the ruins.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Your temper almost cost us back there.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: My anger has helped keep you alive. What was that worth?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Not much if it costs me Zaya’s life. What do you have to be angry about? Thoth and Hathor look at Bek. Doesn’t he know where they are?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Bek) Here is where Osiris fell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (looking around) Set salted the earth?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: It wasn’t Set. It was my mother’s tears.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I think it’s more than his murder eating at you.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I don’t care what you think.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Even with one eye, you complain about being weak. Weak is not throwing spears for miles. Weak is not flying up to the sun. Weak is not winning when you’re outnumbered five to one.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I did not choose a path of revenge. I did not choose to be king. I chose none of this. (beat) So you tell me -- what kind of power do I really have?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You sound like a mortal. Tough to feel powerless, isn't it? They all hear the “living windstorm” blow out of nowhere. Horus, Bek and Hathor know this sound...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: The wind sounds alive...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: It is. Horus readies his spear. They all peer into the fog... Ahead, a giant FALLEN PILLAR blocks their way.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: That pillar was not there before. The pillar MOVES... RISING UP -- It's a GIGANTIC BLACK COBRA. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Cobra towers over them. The “wind” is its vicious HIS

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Run?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: It’s too close.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: So what do we do? Horus doesn’t know. His confidence is shaken... But Bek realizes Horus is their only chance...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Is strength all that makes you a god? Horus gathers himself, holding forth his spear...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Serpent, depart from us now or I will divide your head in two. The Cobra’s HOOD FLARES, preparing to strike... Horus squints his good eye, aiming... lets his spear FLY The spear GRAZES the Cobra’s scales... but MISSES. Horus curses. Now his weapon is gone, lost in the fog. A SECOND COBRA, this one WHITE, rears up to join the firs

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Well, its head is divided in two. The Cobras bare FANGS like ivory scimitars and SPIT strea of BURNING VENOM like napalm -- Horus raises a flat CHUNK OF STONE to SHIELD them. The marble DISINTEGRATES under the onslaught of burning venom

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to the rest of them) Now run. Bek, Hathor and Thoth SPRINT into the fog... Horus is alone with the monsters. A SLURPING sound as the Cobras draw more venom, reloading... They SPIT -- Horus DODGES twin annihilating sprays. He kn he can’t outrun this doom... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus CIRCLES BACK... straight at the Black Cobra. The Cobras abort their attack to avoid burning each other But now Horus is close enough to be bitten. He barely twi OUT OF THE WAY as fangs scissor the air...

dialogues.speaker: BEK, HATHOR AND THOTH
dialogues.text: Take cover behind some ruins... Hathor sees a STREAK cutt a trail through the fog --

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (shouts to Horus) Look out!

dialogues.speaker: THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: Speeds toward Horus, pulled by supernaturally swift horse Almost too fast to see. Astarte AT THE REINS. Anat beside her, teeth bared in blo lust, swings her BATTLE AXE at Horus as they ZING PAST -- Horus DUCKS, feels the blade whistle past his ear...

dialogues.speaker: ANAT ON THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: PLAYS a series of notes on her wooden FLUTE... THE BLACK COBRA obeys the musical command. GRABS Horus in coil of its tail... ON THOTH. He hears the FLUTE... Realizes their method.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Of course, the tones... Thoth scans the ground...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Now to find a suitable branch and carve a simulacrum. Crouched nearby, Hathor rolls her eyes. Typical Thoth. Bek BOUNDS UP a broken ramp of stones, on a mission...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Trapped in the Black Cobra’s embrace... He struggles to f his arms as the serpent’s JAWS OPEN... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANAT AND ASTARTE
dialogues.text: Circle back on the chariot, relishing Horus’ predicament.

dialogues.speaker: ANAT
dialogues.text: He’s no falcon.

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: Leave a piece for me. Astarte HANDS THE REINS to Anat... and DISMOUNTS at a run Astarte HEADS INTO THE RUINS after the others, using her FLUTE to call the White Cobra to her...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Pulls one arm FREE as the Black Cobra STRIKES -- Horus HAMMERS the Cobra’s FANG with his FIST. The force o the blow SNAPS OFF the giant tooth. The Black Cobra RECOI leaking venom from the broken stump. Horus sees Anat steer the CHARIOT around for another run. He can’t DISENTANGLE from loosened coils fast enough... Anat raise her AXE. This time she’ll have Horus’ head...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: JUMPS from a high wall ONTO THE MOVING CHARIOT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death defying. Bek shoulders Anat’s arm, so that she MISS Horus with the axe... Anat SLICES at Bek... Bek GRABS THE REINS and PULLS -- The HORSES dig in. The Chariot BRAKES HARD -- Anat and Be are both THROWN FREE...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Finally ESCAPES the Black Cobra’s coils... Picks up its BROKEN FANG...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Lays on the ground, stunned. Anat gets to her feet, unfazed by the tumble. Raises her high over Bek... ready to separate his head from his body (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANAT
dialogues.text: (to Bek) Be honored. I’11 keep your skull as a souvenir. Suddenly Anat looks down: the Cobra’s FANG protrudes from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: chest. Anat FALLS DEAD. Horus stands behind her holding the fang like a sword. One goddess down. Bek and Horus catch their breath. It’s obvious to both th they make a good team... but being men, neither say anyth

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (pointing behind Horus) Um -- The Black Cobra REARS UP over Horus, its malice bent towa the one who hurt it. Horus ZIGZAGS into the ruins, the gi serpent in PURSUIT...

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE AND THE WHITE COBRA
dialogues.text: Nose through the fog... Find Hathor, alone. Unarmed. Seemingly helpless.

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: Pretty girl. You don’t belong in battle. Astarte blows a sharp tone on her FLUTE... The White Cobr bares its fangs, dripping liquid fire...

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: Burn her. Hathor STARES into the reptile’s eyes...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (to the Cobra) What a beautiful creature you are. The Cobra’s pupils WIDEN, hypnotized. Astarte frantically BLOWS the Flute, but the White Cobra isn’t listening now.

dialogues.speaker: ASTARTE
dialogues.text: (to the Cobra) Burn her --

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The giant snake FREEZES in place, in Hathor’s control. Astarte CHARGES Hathor in a fury -- Hathor defiantly holds her ground. We’ve never seen this side of her. Strong. Angry. Powerful.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: You think I’m not a fighter? I just don’t like getting my hands dirty. Hathor flicks a finger as if she had a speck under the na At Hathor’s command, the White Cobra VOMITS AN INFERNO on Astarte. She desperately blows into her Flute... It’s BURNED AWAY a second before she is. The White Cobra then rakes a stream of fire across its ow skin. INCINERATES itself to please its Mistress Hathor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One cobra and one more goddess down, but Hathor collapses from the strain...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Scrambles up onto the giant stone head of Osiris... as th Black Cobra hunts him through the fog... Horus LEAPS ONTO the Black Cobra’s WRITHING BODY, grippin the scales. The Cobra furiously thrashes, trying to shake him -- while Horus CLIMBS hand over hand onto its HEAD... As he’s whipping around, Horus spots his SPEAR -- it’s punched through a monolith of stone, STUCK TIGHT. Its sha point sticks out the other side... Horus STRIKES a blow between the Black Cobra’s inky eyes. Dazing it. Horus wrestles the Cobra backwards... A controlled fall, guided by Horus -- STRAIGHT ONTO THE TIP HIS SPEAR. The Cobra’s own weight drives the spear through its skull which BURSTS into a bubbling mass of fire... Horus drops to the ground. Tired, dirty, victorious.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I am Horus, son of Osiris, and I will never be overthrown. Thoth RUSHES UP, playing a HOMEMADE FLUTE he carved from branch... Then he sees the battle is over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Oh. (off his flute) This would have worked.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (concerned) Hathor?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Fine. Tired. She killed the other one with greater ease than you. Horus shrugs as he wrestles his spear out of the rock...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: And your mortal?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Capable, as always.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Yes, about that. I was thinking --

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Always thinking.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: ...if we do vanquish Set, all the artifacts his power has raised up will fall down.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Good riddance.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Set’s pyramid is made of sand. We'll be standing under it.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: So we'll dig out.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: How will the human survive? Horus avoids Thoth’s gaze.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Evidently you’ve already considered this. WE REVEAL BEK, listening from the other side of a statue. Neither of them knows he’s there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I’1l shield him.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: That might work. Might not. You should tell him.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: And if he declines to take the risk? We can’t get in without him.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: I just believe the truth should always be told.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (hard) I’m standing on my father’s grave and my mother’s tears. I will have justice. ON BEK. Rocked by betrayal. So that’s how it’s going to b

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (under his breath) You'll never get your justice.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: Bek EASES toward the HORSES, who bare their teeth at him. takes FIGS from his pack, tosses one to each horse.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (patting their neck) You know the way to Heliopolis? Hathor comes up behind Bek as he gets on the Chariot.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Ask Horus. Hathor sighs sadly. It doesn't take a genius to do the ma

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I could stop you... Bek puts his hand on Hathor’s arm. Squeezes it with emoti

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You won't. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hathor watches the Chariot ACCELERATE AWAY, faster than t speed of sound...

dialogues.speaker: ONBOARD THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: Bek holds tight as the world RUSHES BY in a hallucinatory trail of light... Bek glances down at his palm: he stole Hathor’s Bracelet Forty-Two Stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zaya labors to complete the Obelisk amongst the thousands The Older Woman just can’t keep pace... The Cruel Oversee raises his baton to deliver additional motivation...

dialogues.speaker: CRUEL OVERSEER
dialogues.text: (to the Older Woman) You don’t stop. Zaya KICKS the Overseer from behind. She staved off the Older Woman’s punishment, but now Zaya’s facing a beating

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (to the Overseer) Do what you have to. I did. Before the Overseer can strike Zaya... he’s HOISTED INTO AIR, raised up the Obelisk like a flag up a pole -- LOOKING CLOSER, there’s a rope hooked to the Overseer’s b He SHOUTS OUT, dangling from up high, drawing everyone's attention --

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Hey. Zaya turns to see Bek standing next to her. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (off the Overseer) Pretty good distraction if you didn't even notice me... There’s no time to celebrate their reunion. Zaya rubs her shoulder. The brand’s still there.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Set’s not dead... Bek puts Hathor’s bracelet on Zaya’s wrist... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter. Bek leads her away, heads down, while everyone else’s eye are on the Overseer...

dialogues.speaker: URSHU AT THE PAVILION
dialogues.text: Sees the disorder in the slave area... But Urshu is not s easily fooled. He looks elsewhere... .-..and spots Bek and Zaya. They’re headed toward the Gat

dialogues.speaker: BEK AND ZAYA
dialogues.text: Reach the threshold of the gate. Bek RUNS PAST. Zaya STOP afraid. Stepping past will trigger the curse...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Trust me. Zaya closes her eyes... and WALKS OUT OF THE GATE... Immediately, the BRAND on Zaya’s shoulder BLOOMS WITH DEC

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: Bek... The bracelet SHINES BRIGHT, repelling the dark corruption completely ERASING THE BRAND. Zaya’s eyes go wide with wonderment. Her curse is lifted.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Told you I’d save you. They JUMP IN the waiting chariot -- FSSST. What was that sound? One of the horses snorting, ready to speed them away?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (turns to Zaya) Let's go... Bek sees an ARROW buried in Zaya’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: She sinks onto the chariot floor.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Zaya? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For a moment that seems endless, Bek doesn’t know what to

dialogues.speaker: URSHU AT THE PAVILION
dialogues.text: Stands with a BOW. He coldly notches another ARROW and shoots again --

dialogues.speaker: BEK IN THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: WHISPERS into the horse’s ear. They TAKE OFF -- Urshu’s second arrow IMPACTS A WALL where the chariot was Now just swirling dust. Bek cradles Zaya in his arms in the moving chariot. The world around them a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus stalks forward, furious. They’ve now reached the RE SANDS of Set’s land... Hathor and Thoth lag behind.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He’1ll meet the fate earned by all traitors.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: You could have averted this.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I’1l do it without him. Thoth is about to contradict this falsehood... then think better of it. THE CHARIOT speeds out of nowhere. Comes to a HALT.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Bek, livid) If you’ve come to beg, you may begin.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Can you help her? The gods see Zaya barely clinging to life. Thoth examines her... but it’s clear to Horus her condition is dire. Hathor gives Zaya a sip from her wineskin.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I can take away her pain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zaya relaxes, soothed by Hathor’s drink. But her breathin is shallow. She’s fading...

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: (to Bek) I’m glad we’re together. Zaya’s eyes close... A final exhale...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I can’t feel her heart... (to Horus) Save her.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: We can’t. ON HORUS. He knows what he needs to do.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (in a quiet voice) Come to me, O Mighty Isis. A mournful CRY pierces the air. A majestic bird, a KITE, swoops down, transforming into ISIS. The wife of Osiris stands before them in all her majesty. The gods take a knee before her... Isis turns up her nose at Hathor like she’s a cheap tramp.

dialogues.speaker: ISIS
dialogues.text: (to Horus) By what right do you summon me? The one who widowed me remains upon my husband’s throne.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I know. Isis rests her palm on Horus’ empty eye, disapproving.

dialogues.speaker: ISIS
dialogues.text: How I wish I had other sons who could honor their father, but Set robbed us of them before they could be born. I only have you. Isis finally notices Bek. He’s distraught, beside the bod of the woman he loves.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Help him, mother. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bek bows before Isis, tear-streaked face in the dirt. It’ heart-rending.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Please... Isis sees Bek’s tears... and her own eyes well with emoti Isis cradles Zaya in the crook of her arm, gently plucks the arrow. Isis cups her hand to her own mouth, and exhal life into her palm. It’s BRIGHT as the noon sun. Isis presses her life-force into Zaya’s chest. The wound seals. Zaya seems to glow from within... Isis WHISPERS in her ear, gentle but insistent... Bek silently prays... The glow fades from Zaya’s body. Isis turns sadly to Bek.

dialogues.speaker: ISIS
dialogues.text: She has passed beyond where I can reach her.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: But you’re a goddess... Isis’ shoulders sag under the weight of another defeat. Another death. Horus’ fists clench with helpless grief. Hathor tears up. Thoth bows his head in respect. Bek sits in the dirt, staring vacantly. He’s empty. Isis removes her own silky cape to wrap the dead Zaya, cocooning her in a BURIAL SHROUD worthy of a god.

dialogues.speaker: ISIS
dialogues.text: May she find the joy denied to us. Isis transforms and FLIES AWAY, alone once more. Bek hands Hathor the bracelet he stole...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Punish me.

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: That’s not what I do. Horus PUNCHES a nearby cliff side... creating a small CAV (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: She needs to be buried. INT. ZAYA’S TOMB The proper burial HIEROGLYPHICS are inscribed on the cave walls. Zaya’s wrapped body is laid in state. Thoth waves incense... The smoke does not rise. It burrow into the earth...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: O thou who art Everlasting, send your servant Anubis to guide the dead to new life. A PASSAGE OPENS in the SMOKY VEIL cloaking the floor...

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: Rises. The intimidating guide to the Afterlife. A JACKAL’ HEAD with fur black as the grave. A man’s body, taut and sinewy. Yet his eyes are strangely calming, promising absolute peace. ON BEK. Unnerved... Anubis nods to the gods, who return the courtesy. Hathor puts her BRACELET on Zaya’s wrist.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You would give her that?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Of course. Anubis touches the bracelet, and a SMOKY OUTLINE OF THE TREASURE flows down into the passage...

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: (to Zaya’s body) She is made mighty before Ra. She shall enter the hidden gate with power. Anubis reaches into the shrouded body as if it were intangible, and PULLS OUT ZAYA by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: (to Zaya’s body) You are released. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: At first glance, Zaya seems alive... but her skin has a s movement to it as well...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Zaya -- But Zaya can’t hear him. She can only see that which lies before her...

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: The doors of earth are opened to you. Anubis leads Zaya DOWN THE PASSAGE opened in the floor... The path tunnels into the darkness of ANOTHER DIMENSION.. TWELVE GATES mark the path -- ancient arches hewn from st older than time. Each Gate must be passed to reach the wa bright LIGHT at the end. ON BEK. The light is beautiful, beckoning in the distance Anubis LEADS Zaya by the hand toward the First Gate... ON HORUS, looking at Bek losing his love forever... There must be something he can do... Maybe there is.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Anubis, who directs your path?

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: He who wears the crown of Egypt rules all Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: If I take the crown from Set, I can command you to turn back?

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: If I have not yet escorted her through the Twelfth Gate, she may return. But no one may leave the Afterlife once entered.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: The journey takes twelve hours, one for every hour of the night.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Walk slowly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: As slowly as I dare. The smoke BLOWS AWAY, erasing the passage. Zaya is gone.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Bek) If Set is slain before Zaya reaches her journey’s end, I can bring her back to you. ON BEK. A rush of determination. And hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus, Bek, Hathor and Thoth trudge through a SANDSTORM.. Can’t see more than a few inches in front of them... All at once the storm CLEARS as they reach the calm eye i the center of this hurricane... SET’S TEMPLE A massive PYRAMID. It seems smooth and sharp-edged... but it’s made of blood red SAND held together by Set’s magic. The Pyramid’s surface is in constant motion, as if each g of sand were alive... The grinding movement is as deafeni as a waterfall. They MOVE CLOSE enough for grains of sand to spit off and bite their cheeks... but Bek can’t see any visible openin Then the sand parts, opening a DOORWAY into the Pyramid.. After a moment it’s erased. ANOTHER DOOR OPENS, then CLOSES... A repeating invitation...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: I was here once...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Did you go in one of those doors?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: It was late. I was drunk. Hathor would rather not talk about it...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Set told me to keep close or I'd never get out. I thought I was going to be crushed, but I followed him to a big metal wheel... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He turned it, and just like that, everything went still. ON BEK. How to get in? The Pyramid’s doors continually OP and CLOSE... Beckoning just long enough to seem like a re option...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to Horus) How long have we got? Horus focuses his eye beyond our earthly realm... HORUS’ P.O.V. Zaya and Anubis walk under another arch on Afterlife path...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: She passes the Eleventh Gate. Be quick. Bek studies the pattern of doors opening and closing... H sees the answer. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Ever seen the shell game? (they haven't) We mortals use it to swindle coins from fools. Three shells, pick the right one and you win. Only you can’t win. It’s fixed. Bek hopes he’s right...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: See you inside. Bek IGNORES the opening and closing doors. Instead, Bek SPRINTS straight at the Pyramid’s WALL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hathor grips Horus’ wrist -- she thinks Bek’s going to di Bek RUNS THROUGH THE WALL like a knife through a red woun INT. SET’S TEMPLE OF SHIFTING SAND Bek’s in a cavernous, disorienting SPACE out of M.C. Esch nightmares. Millions of tons of sand flowing in a mad architecture of ARCHWAYS, STAIRWAYS and BRIDGES... Formin into SOLID STONE for a moment... than reverting back into rivers of sand. Ahead, Bek sees THE WHEEL Hathor mentioned -- the mechani that shuts off the Pyramid’s shifting sand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Wheel is the only thing not moving, attached to a sol post like the steering wheel on a ship. Bek feels a rush of euphoria. Maybe this is going to work The floor begins to DISINTEGRATE underfoot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLIGHT OF STAIRS sails past... No time to think about i He LEAPS ONTO THE STAIRS... BOUNDS UP as steps MELT behin him... At the top, Bek has a choice between TWO identical BRIDGE straddling the swirling space... But which one?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Roll the bones... Bek SPRINTS onto one BRIDGE... as the other BRIDGE is SWE AWAY in an eddy of sand. Lucky, lucky. He’s still alive, but this is not sustainable. Bek LEAPS from SOLID ROCK to SOLID ROCK... He glimpses th Wheel through the flowing maze. Before it’s gobbled up again, Bek JUMPS OFF THE EDGE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONTO A STONE ARCH. He holds on... riding the arch like a wave. Just before it crumbles he JUMPS one last time... FALLING through the red void -- Bek GRABS onto the Wheel for dear life. BUFFETED on all sides... Bek won’t let go. He manages to CRANK the WHEEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once the sand of Set’s Pyramid turns SOLID --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus, Hathor and Thoth ENTER from a HALLWAY that’s now j normal stone.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (slaps Bek on the back) Well done.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (cracks his knuckles) Which way to the Sphinx? INT. INNER CHAMBER - SET’S PYRAMID Horus, Hathor, Thoth and Bek ENTER a great CHAMBER. Lit f below by flickering FIRELIGHT. Horus girds himself, spear raised... as SOMETHING HUGE emerges from the shadows: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE SPHINX
dialogues.text: Stares down. The head of an implacable man in royal headdress, atop the fearsome body of a lion. Golden fur rippling. Spiked tail swaying...

dialogues.speaker: THE SPHINX
dialogues.text: Trespassers in the house of the king, answer my riddle or cease to be. Horus confronts the Sphinx himself.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Why do you serve that murderous backstabber?

dialogues.speaker: THE SPHINX
dialogues.text: A riddle for me, son of Osiris? (answers matter-of-fact) I serve the king.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You were created to serve Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPHINX
dialogues.text: Egypt and the King are one. (beat) Now answer my riddle, or cease to be.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Go on. I’m waiting. The Sphinx focuses its menace on Thoth. Asks its riddle:

dialogues.speaker: THE SPHINX
dialogues.text: I never was, am always to be. No one ever saw me, nor ever will. And yet I am the confidence of all who live and breathe. (beat) What am I? Seconds tick by as Thoth thinks... Horus, Bek and Hathor wait...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (with certainty) Order. You are order. The Sphinx ATTACKS Thoth, blindingly fast -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus GRAPPLES the Sphinx, fur in his fists, barely preventing Thoth’s decapitation. Hathor and Bek dodge the Sphinx’s WHIPPING TAIL...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Thoth) Try... again... please...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: That was a completely suitable answer. (to the Sphinx) You are... purity. Wrong. The Sphinx SLAMS Horus into the wall with earthqua force. Thoth racks his brain. Rattled now, off his game.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: “I never was, am always to be. No one ever saw me, nor ever will.” (stream of consciousness) In the future. Nonexistent. Yet it exists. Ephemeral. Imaginary. Horus braces his forearm under the beast’s chin, JAWS inc from his face... Its tail LASHES HIM... Horus can’t keep this up long... Hathor and Bek can only watch...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: “And yet I am the confidence of all who live and breathe.” Live and breathe... Live and breathe...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Stop thinking like a god.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (snaps ) Then I might as well stop thinking. Thoth glances at Bek. Clarity coming...

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: What is the confidence of mortals? Their lives are so short, but their hope remains undimmed for... for... The Sphinx finally FLINGS Horus aside... It rears up, rea to slay Thoth -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (answers the riddle) You are tomorrow. The Sphinx sinks to all fours and TURNS TO STONE. Do we detect relief on its face? Fairly defeated, it no longer must serve Set.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Ha! I am Thoth, God of Knowledge, Master of Truth. Horus advances to A VOLCANIC PIT. It seems to go down forever. It is the primordial fire that begat the desert sands... Horus kneels at the edge and unslings his flask, filled w WATER OF CREATION...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Do it. Horus POURS the water into the pit... In moments, the fir will be doused, and Set’s power with it... But the water merely splashes onto SOLID GROUND. Wasted.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (confused) What? Where’s the pit? The room seems to warp... Horus staggers, his senses CONFOUNDED... Bek and Hathor a DISORIENTED, too... Horus realizes they’re in a trap.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: He’s here. ON THOTH. He stops short, stunned: Set stands before him. He appeared out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You are Thoth, God of Fools. Set magically punches his hand though Thoth’s forehead an pulls out his BRAIN. Thoth’s essence looks like smooth bl LAPIS in Set’s hand. Thoth crumples, BABBLING NONSENSE. Horus squints in Set’s direction... unable to get a bead him. Set’s POWER OF CONFUSION has addled his sight... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (to Horus) Thank you. You lured Thoth from his library so I didn’t have to. Set secures Thoth’s brain into its place on his HELMET.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: The final piece. Set stands back and beholds his terrible masterpiece. The ARMOR gleams with the spellbinding power of the gods.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Why steal so much power? You’re already stronger than anyone, except... (realizing, alarmed) Ra. For this is Set’s true target...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Ra had two sons... but he only granted one the power to give life. (bitterly) Unlike Osiris, I can never have a child. My children are nothing but wind and sand. Horus has to snap himself out of Set’s spell... He slides his palm down the BLADE of his SPEAR. Welcoming the PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You are a failure, but at least my brother had someone to seek vengeance in his name. All I am will end with me... So I choose never to end. I will take Ra‘’s place in eternity. The pain allows Horus to see Set clearly: Set seizes Hathor and drags her to the actual pit -- Horus THROWS HIS SPEAR at Set -- the best aim he can must But it only glances Set’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (to Hathor) I’ll miss the wine. Set FLINGS Hathor OVER THE EDGE OF THE PIT -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: No -- Horus DIVES after her --

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE PIT
dialogues.text: FALLING... Horus GRABS Hathor, both plummeting toward the FIRE at the center of the world. Horus GRABS a jutting ledge of STONE. Horus and Hathor ha on for their very existence...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (to Horus) Don’t let go...

dialogues.speaker: SET ABOVE THEM
dialogues.text: Casually glances down... Horus hugs Hathor to his chest.. KICKS a TOEHOLD. JAMS FINGERS into STONE. He CLIMBS, inch by inch... But it’s clear he’s already lost.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Leans his shoulder against Set’s armor, pushing it to the edge of the pit... It totters precariously. Another shove and it’1ll fall in.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to Set) This important to you? Bek has Set’s undivided attention.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Stop. (re: Horus) Why would you fight a god’s war?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s my friend...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Or maybe you have a deal with him. (probing) The girl who walks with Anubis? Set can see he’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: It’s too late. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Look into the Eye. Bek stares into the “Eye of Horus” GEMSTONE on the Helmet Its magic allows Bek to see into the beyond... BEK’'S P.O.V. Set is telling the truth. Anubis guides Zay through the Twelfth and final Gate. She DISAPPEARS into t light of the Afterlife. Bek is undone by sadness, the ARMOR SLIPPING in his grip.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Spare my armor, and I will help you.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (hollow) You can’t.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: No King of Egypt can bring her back, now or ever... But I can make you wealthy enough to buy your way into the Afterlife. (beat) Only there can you be reunited with your love. ON HORUS, down in the pit... still a long way to climb...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (shouts up to Bek) Don’t. ON BEK. In the depths of despair, he makes his choice: Bek pulls the armor back from the edge and gives it to Se

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Unlike some, my oath is good. ON HORUS. His anger at Bek blazes hot as the fire below.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You white-livered mortal...

dialogues.speaker: SET ABOVE
dialogues.text: Stands beside Bek. Bek’s shoulders bow. A broken man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Set waves his hand -- and a WALL DISSIPATES... Revealing HOARD OF TREASURE.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: My temple shall be your burial chamber. Now you may pay Anubis, and find the way open. Set hands Bek a bejeweled DAGGER... Bek stares at it numb

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: If you haven’t the stomach for it, just wait a moment... Set gestures at the roof. Obeying his spell, the Pyramid SHUDDERS. In a few minutes it will collapse... Set EXITS with his ARMOR. ON BEK. Forlorn. Fine showers of sand already falling...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (bitterly, off the treasure) Always wanted a big funeral. Bek positions the knife over his heart... None of this is right and he knows it...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Just close your eyes and do it. Bek puts everything out of his mind. Stop thinking about what you've done... Countdown to suicide: three, two... Horus SWATS away the knife before Bek can drive it in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Son of Osiris BURNS, wreathed in the FIRE of his ange

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You denied me my vengeance...

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Horus, don’t -- Horus SHOVES the treasure INTO THE PIT. It melts to nothingness. With this vindictive act, Horus denies Bek t Afterlife.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Bek) You will never see your love now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horus is surprised Bek does not rage back, or plead. has something to get off his chest.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: The night I lost Zaya to the slavers, I didn’t know what to do. I was lost. So I called out to you. To save her. And me. (beat) Growing up, I thought you were the bravest thing in all creation. So I hated you for not coming to our rescue. Horus doesn’t know how to react to this...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I didn’t hear.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: No, you didn't listen. 95. But Bek A section of the ceiling falls behind them... Soon the wh place will come tumbling down... Bek sits and waits to di

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (despairing) I’ve finally learned the lesson of the gods. We don’t matter to you. Even if we wish we did. ON HORUS. Profoundly moved. Here is this mortal, so fragi and yet so strong. But the selfish actions of the gods -- especially Horus -- have crushed Bek’s spirit. Horus’ anger subsides. The flames WITHER AWAY. Molten san cools to red glass.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You do matter. Horus humbly TAKES A KNEE before Bek.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I am sorry. ON BEK. Of all the improbable things he’s seen, Horus on bended knee is the least likely.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Perhaps one day you’1l forgive me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: We've both made mistakes. Avalanches of sand COMING DOWN all around them now...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Then there’s much we still must do. But first, I swear you will not be buried here. Horus spots the GIANT WHEEL through crumbling walls... an TEARS IT OFF ITS POST. Hathor scoops up Thoth’s body... Horus holds the Wheel over their heads like a shield...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Stay close -- The entire Pyramid of sand comes CRASHING DOWN around the ON HORUS, muscles straining against the thundering downpour... Until we can see only RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Great Obelisk stands like a colossal stone sword. Now FINISHED, stabbing the heavens... Set is pleased. Urshu, the Overseers, and thousands of Slaves bow before him.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (addressing the Slaves) Your task is complete at the hour I demanded. You have earned a great honor. Overseers force the Slaves INSIDE THE OBELISK...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You will serve me for eternity. Set slides a massive slab across the door, sealing them i

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE OBELISK
dialogues.text: Slaves POUND desperately against unyielding stone. Envelo in DARKNESS. The Older Woman Slave drops to her knees...

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN SLAVE
dialogues.text: _. (praying) . ; Hail Horus, Son of Osiris, he with golden eyes like the noonday sun. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN SLAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are your followers. Please deliver us.

dialogues.speaker: HOPELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Why pray? He isn’t coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Obelisk’s high peak, the evening sky’s purple cano is close enough to touch... Set fastens his ARMOR. Dons his helmet. Extends his wings As the SUN dips to the horizon... Ra’s boat sails ABOVE h Set LAUNCHES himself off the Obelisk. FLIES like a GLIDER Air currents silently lift his wings through the darkenin sky, toward Ra’s boat... EXT. RA’S BOAT - DUSK Ra cranks out the last links of the chain to the sun... letting his boat drift into DARKNESS. He stands at the bo spear ready... Set LANDS quietly behind Ra... and pulls his cloak around himself to conceal the armor. Set gazes down at the shimmering NILE...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (off the view) It was never supposed to be so green. Ra turns at Set’s voice -- surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Set. It must have taken great effort to get up here. You always were clever.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: How else could we speak? You do not let your feet touch Egypt’s sand.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Your contendings with Horus are not my concern. Leave me to prepare for my nightly chore. Movement in the deep as Ra’s boat nears the demon Apophis (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You have nothing more to say? Much history has been written since last we spoke.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You came all this way to hear my words? Hear them then, and carry them in your heart. (harsh) If my feet were on Egypt’s sand, Osiris would not have been the son who died. ON SET. It cuts deep, even after all that’s come to pass. The echo of Apophis’ starved GROWL shakes the boat...

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: (to Set) Now go. The hour comes for me to turn back chaos.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Why? Set brandishes his scepter... Ra turns on Set with fury..

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: You raise your arm against me? Ra STRIKES the upstart Set with a BLAST OF SOLAR FIRE fro his spear. BURNING LIGHT envelops Set... Ra watches with emotion the seeming death of his son at his own hand. But as the light dims, Set REMAINS STANDING.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: No god could withstand that...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I’m not just one god. Set’s cloak has burned away, revealing the ARMOR beneath. the jeweled body parts still hot with Ra’s light. Set HAMMERS Ra with his scepter -- Ra tumbles OFF THE BOAT, stunned, into the OCEAN OF DARKNESS... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Apophis, quench your thirst. The darkness UNCOILS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIST punches up from the sand... Horus RISES, helps up Hathor. Bek behind them. They all gulp in cool night air. The STONE SPHINX is revealed, half-buried, rising from th desert floor... Where it can still be seen to this day. What looks like a BRIGHT STAR falls from the heavens... R

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: (re: Set) He did it. At the far rim of the world, a BLACKNESS darker than nigh brewing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Older Woman Slave still prays... Around her, moans an the occasional sob. The air in the Obelisk is running out

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN SLAVE
dialogues.text: (weakly) Hail Horus, Son of Osiris... He with golden eyes like the noonday sun... We are your... followers. Please... From outside, a FIST hammers through the stone... LIGHT pours in... Slaves blink at the radiance...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (from outside) I hear you...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE OBELISK
dialogues.text: Horus smashes OPEN the DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: ...and you shall be freed. Bek watches the Slaves RUN OUT OF THE OBELISK... their fa shining with gratitude. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: That was a great thing you did.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I did what any king would do for his people. ON BEK. Did Horus just say “king?”

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Thought you didn’t want to be king?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (clasps Bek’s shoulder) I just hadn’t gotten to know my people. Horus radiates a power and grandeur Bek’s never seen in h before.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (off the Slaves) They won’t truly be free until Set’s curse is cleansed from their flesh. Apophis’ infernal ROAR makes the ground tremble. Unnatura night cloaks the horizon. This thing of nightmares travel in a HAZE OF DARKNESS. Approaching fast...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Apophis. The Demon of Chaos. It’s drawn to the Nile, the source of all life.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: To drink it. Bek looks around at lush, green Egypt... His home. He pal at the thought of its destruction.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Only Ra can banish Apophis. (pointing) But he needs that. RA’S SPEAR sticks up from the center of an IMPACT CRATER. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: If we return his spear to him, he'll be revived. The SOUND OF BEATING WINGS overhead... Set DESCENDS from the sky... BLOCKING Bek and Horus from spear. Set’s surprised Horus is alive -- but not that surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You could have gone peacefully into the fire. (to Bek) And you rejected my gift. Behind Set, Urshu leads a CADRE OF SOLDIERS to Ra’s Spear Urshu wrenches the heavy spear from the ground...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (to Urshu) Take it into the Obelisk. Ten mountains-worth of stone will bury Ra’s spear forever. Urshu heaves Ra’s Spear over his shoulder, carries it TOW THE OBELISK. The rest of the Soldiers flank their god... .»..as Set readies his scepter to take on Horus.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Bek) Get the spear.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (off Set) He’1ll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Not right away. (a farewell) You’re a good man. Bek SPRINTS after Urshu... Apophis’ ROAR rattles the world. The blackness blotting t horizon takes SERPENTINE FORM... Set comes at Horus, scepter swinging. Horus PARRIES -- But Set is stronger since they last fought. And Horus weaker. The force of Set’s BLOWS knocks Horus to his knee (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You overestimate yourself. I suppose the son always becomes the father.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Not always. Set cocks back for another brutal swing -- Suddenly Set’s own Soldiers attack him. Harmless, yet distracting as a swarm of flies.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (angrily, to his Soldiers) What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: HATHOR
dialogues.text: Maybe they’ve finally realized what a jackass you are. ON HATHOR, nearby. She’s using her power of suggestion to control Set’s Soldiers like marionettes. Set KNOCKS ASIDE his mesmerized Soldiers... but it allows Horus precious seconds to get to his feet...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to Hathor) Get back -- Too late. Set SLAMS Hathor with his scepter. At the sight of his fallen beloved, Horus’ rage explodes.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: If you’ve killed her... Horus rushes to Hathor’s side. She’s alive, but unconscio

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: I won't until I’ve had her one last time. We’ll use your corpse for a bed. EMANATING HEAT, Horus CHARGES Set -- Set OVERTURNS a big URN from among the stockpile of build supplies. LIQUID flows across Horus’ path... It's OIL. Set smirks. He’s baited Horus once again.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Burn. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A flood of oil that could light a thousand lamps now spla across Horus’ scalding feet... His anger sparks a small FLOWER OF FLAME. The fire licks the surface... GROWING... Horus takes a breath. Bek’s words echoing in his head...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (to himself) Remember who you are... Horus cools. To Set’s dismay, Horus presses his palm on t growing flame... and EXTINGUISHES it.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Aren’t you angry? Surely your mother’s cries still echo in your ears? Your father’s sundered corpse still stains your mind?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Today I’m not a son avenging his father. (beat) I'm a king protecting his people.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You're not king yet. Horus ATTACKS. Drives Set down a LOADING CANAL used for ferrying blocks of limestone... All the way to the

dialogues.speaker: DOCKS ON THE SHORE OF THE NILE
dialogues.text: Hundreds of BOATS here -- all abandoned now. Horus JABS Set in the chest. Set staggers... But _in his armor, Set cannot be harmed.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Angry or calm, it makes no difference. It’s too late now. Horus watches in horror as the FOREST on the FAR SHORE SHAKES... Trees uprooted...

dialogues.speaker: THE DEMON APOPHIS
dialogues.text: Slithers INTO THE NILE, sending WAVES crashing ashore... A wall of water SWEEPS Horus and Set ONTO A SAILBOAT. Apophis begins to DRINK the Nile. Its gargantuan MOUTH sucking in water like a vortex into hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus and Set’s boat is PULLED AWAY FROM SHORE by the current, along with EVERY BOAT ON THE RIVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bek ENTERS the Obelisk’s PITCH BLACK cavernous space... He can hear Urshu’s FOOTSTEPS ahead... then the quiet ech of a CRANKED LEVER -- An ominous RUMBLE... Whether by machination, magic, or both... the Obelisk is starting to FALL. SHAFTS OF LIGHT angle through CRACKS in the miles-high interior... As the light increases, Bek notices he stands amongst ROPES ON PULLEYS, hanging like cables to the star Bek spots Urshu in the center of the Obelisk... Urshu pla Ra’s Spear on the floor and awaits his doom...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You picked the wrong god to follow.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: Oh? Horus is out there dying. Chunks of stone RAIN DOWN around them...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: So will you.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: I’m the richest man in Egypt. Soon I‘ll be in the Afterlife. But you'll be nowhere. Urshu grins at Bek as a massive piece of stone PLUMMETS d at them -- Bek grabs a rope and SWINGS... PLUCKS Ra’s Spear off the floor in the nick time -- Urshu_is CRUSHED. Bek, Ra’s spear in hand, runs for the EXIT...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS AND SET ON THE RIVER
dialogues.text: DUEL on the out-of-control sailboat... Every time Apophis SWALLOWS, it pulls their sailboat a li closer to its giant maw... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HUNDREDS OF BOATS clog the river, all COLLIDING... A grow LOGJAM drawn inexorably toward destruction... Horus’ spear sends up SPARKS every time it glances off Se impenetrable armor...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: Why keep fighting? Horus is flagging... None of his blows matter. A Galleon SMASHES into the sailboat, as boats PILE ON TOP ONE ANOTHER in the diminishing space -- Apophis’ GAPING MOUTH rises over them like a black hole - Horus TRANSFORMS into a Falcon... FLIES OFF THE SAILBOAT just before it’s EATEN by the Demon. Wings beating to ESCAPE the gale force draft, the Falcon barely makes it --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SHORE
dialogues.text: A SCEPTER slams the Falcon OUT OF THE SKY -- wielded by S in his FLYING ARMOR. The Falcon CRASHES... TRANSFORMING back into the shape of battered man.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: (savagely) I want you to hurt. Because they all loved you, no matter what you did... ON BEK. Watching helplessly... Set hefts his Scepter two-handed... Brings it down upon Horus with such force the earth SPLITS beneath him. Horus lies stunned...

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: No matter that you were not worthy. Bek desperately RUSHES Set, a meaningless attack -- Set SEIZES Bek by the THROAT, holds the mortal close.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: You could have been in the next life with a gentle breeze at your cheek. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: I wanted to give you back your dagger. Bek STABS Set with the bejeweled dagger --

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: For Horus. The dagger melts against the god’s armor like butter. Set SWATS Bek aside with an awful crack -- Bek lands in a heap, fragile bones shattered. Horus kneel by him.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: “For Horus?”

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (painfully chuckles) Too much? They clasp hands. Brothers in this battle for creation. Horus wheels on Set, raises his spear -- Set looks upon Horus... But something’s different: Horus is looking at him with both his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BEK, smiling through the pain.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Set’s eyes misdirected on the dagger in Bek’s right hand, while the left snatches Horus’ eye from the helmet...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Alarmed, Set claws at his Helmet’s visor... There is a HO where HORUS’ EYE used to be.

dialogues.speaker: SET
dialogues.text: No... HORUS’ P.O.V. A clear shot at the chink in Set’s helmet - Horus THROWS his spear -- This time, it flies RAZOR-STRAIGHT, cleaving Set’s head w a_burst of white fire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus stalks to Set’s twitching body, tears off the armor and PULLS SET’S HEART FROM HIS CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Go back to nothing. Horus THROWS Set’s essence INTO APOPHIS’ HUNGRY MOUTH. As billion teeth gnash it... Set turns to dust. His armor an empty shell... The multitude of Slaves feel their skin HEAL, as their br vanish along with Set’s curse... But the unquenchable Apophis keeps drinking... Horus transforms into a FALCON... soars INTO THE SKY with Ra’s Spear in its talons --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ra floats unconscious in the storm-tossed sea of darkness The Falcon Horus bites Ra’s shoulder... Ra’s eyes snap OP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ra DESCENDS in all his glory.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Enough, beast. Ra unleashes a STORM OF SOLAR FIRE from his spear -- Apophis BELLOWS, but this time in fear. The Demon RETREAT across the horizon... Gone back to the darkness. Horus rushes to Bek’s side... He’s dying. But he looks at the world he’s saved with satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Are you sure you’re not a god?

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: What would I be the god of? Stupidity?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: The Impossible. Bek likes that... until the pain edges thought away. Bek’ wounds finally overcome him. He dies. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Horus bows his head in grief.

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: My king. Grim Anubis salutes the new ruler of Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: ANUBIS
dialogues.text: Command me as you will. ON HORUS. It hadn’t occurred to him until now that the cr is his... He gazes at the body of his fallen friend.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Take him to his love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anubis guides Bek along the path, emptiness to his left a right... Past the Twelfth Gate, the Afterlife beckons... Bek leaves all the burdens of the past behind as he gratefully STEPS INTO THE LIGHT. INT. ZAYA’S TOMB - LATER Horus sadly places Bek’s linen-wrapped body next to Zaya’ He feels a thrum of power as Ra himself ENTERS. The tomb distorts around him -- for wh earthly room can hold the majesty of the sun?

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: I have never been in debt. And yet I am in debt to you, grandson. (beat) Ask whatever you will that we might balance the scales. Mountains will kneel before you. The winds will do your bidding. Answer quickly, for Apophis still hungers, night is always coming, and my blade is dull.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Once I’d have taken such power for myself... (off Bek’s body) But now I want nothing -- except what’s impossible for me to give. WE PUSH IN to Bek’s wrapped body... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BURST OF pure light and Ra is GONE. The room reshapes.. Bek sits up, bound in the linens. Horus unwraps his frien Bek looks around, trying to get his bearings...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Back? Yes. (points) You might want to help her. Bek sees Zaya is similarly struggling to unwrap herself. unwraps Zaya... Her green eyes flash, alive and happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lovers embrace. Together at last. Horus gathers them both in a big bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: (greeting Zaya) I’m Horus.

dialogues.speaker: ZAYA
dialogues.text: My lord... Zaya bows to him, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (to Horus) I thought this was impossible?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Impossible? Yes. Bek smiles. Touche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great CROWD. HUMANS from all walks of life. GODS of all shapes and sizes. Everyone gathered for the coronation. Behind the throne, Bek stands dressed in royal finery, Za at his side. All the major gods are present. Among them, Nephthys flex her restored wings... Above, the sun shines. Squint and you can see Ra’s boat, dependable as clockwork... Thoth finally soaks up the sun’s embrace with pleasure... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hathor gazes at Horus, beaming with love... Horus kneels... as Isis places the Double Crown of Egypt his head. A reconciliation for mother and son.

dialogues.speaker: ISIS
dialogues.text: My heart is found. Horus ADDRESSES the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: What happens to a man when he must buy his way into the life after death? He will lie, cheat, steal, kill, and enslave to gather the treasure he needs. And what of those men who will never be rich enough? If their cause is hopeless, why would they act any better? (beat ) From this moment on, the Afterlife must be earned not with gold, but by good deeds, compassion and generosity. To you who have little worldly treasure, the door is now open to you. To you who have much, your riches will mean nothing when you die. (beat) This life matters. CHEERS for the King. ON HORUS. He feels the North Wind softly blow... and he knows that his father is proud.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: (low, to Horus) The day you finally make me rich, you do this?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: (to Horus, peeved) Just like that you’re changing the rules of the Afterlife? Without first consulting the God of Wisdom?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lll.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: This system will never work. Who’s to judge whether a man is worthy or not?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You recognize truth, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: You're hired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urshu arrogantly passes through the Twelfth Gate on his w to the Afterlife -- when Anubis STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: (to Anubis, irritated) Have you not been paid? Thoth blocks the path to the Afterlife.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: You need only answer my question and I will judge its truth. (beat) Are you a good man?

dialogues.speaker: URSHU
dialogues.text: The best.

dialogues.speaker: THOTH
dialogues.text: The only one who believes that is you. Thoth jerks his head to Anubis, who TOSSES Urshu off the path, into NOTHINGNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All across Heliopolis, the PEOPLE are rebuilding... No longer slaves.

dialogues.speaker: HORUS AND BEK ON A BALCONY
dialogues.text: Look across the Nile Valley... and beyond, at the encroac DESERT. They’re blown by a gritty gust of wind...

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: I hate the sand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Get used to it. Horus spots Hathor below, surrounded by admirers... She won't meet Horus’ eye even though she knows he’s watching

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: She’s in a mood. I can’t tell if she’s mad I haven’t yet asked her to be queen -- or if she’s mad that I am going to ask her and she doesn’t want a husband.

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: You want my counsel as Chief Advisor to the King?

dialogues.speaker: HORUS
dialogues.text: Tell her about the first time I saw her, right? Something about sunsets...

dialogues.speaker: BEK
dialogues.text: Just go to her bedchamber. (beat) And bring the crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOTH’S VOICE speaks to us... Egypt looks like the arid l we now know. THOTH’S VOICE And so Egypt was saved. But the God of the Desert forever left his mark on our once green paradise... (sighs) So much for our greatest creation -- which I suppose must now be Man, by default. Perhaps in time you will be ready to rule yourselves. Until then, remember well as you travel your path toward the Afterlife... (beat) Be good -- or I‘1l know.
